items.title: Today's Local Media: Online Marketing Specialist
items.content:
Online Marketing Specialist

Job Description

Are you passionate about helping businesses grow? Do you have experience building and optimizing online advertising campaigns? Are you ready for a new adventure? If so, we are looking for you!

Today's Local Media is a fast growing digital marketing agency looking for an Online Marketing Specialist to help us continue our incredible growth. The team is 100% remote and this role is available to anyone in North America.

This role will start at part-time and could become full-time in the future for the right candidate.

Responsibilities

The Online Marketing Specialist will be responsible for helping our clients grow. This means assisting with everything from setting up Google Ads to Facebook remarketing and everything in between including:

  1. Creating new Google, Bing, and Facebook ads campaigns including setup, ad copy, keywords, and audiences
  2. Optimizing existing Google, Bing, and Facebook ad campaigns including campaign structure, bid adjustments, and conversion rate optimization
  3. Managing new client onboarding from beginning to end
  4. Setup goals and call tracking software to ensure end-to-end reporting and analysis
  5. Performing on-page website audit and providing conversion rate optimization recommendations
  6. Building mock ups and wireframes of landing pages designed to convert more leads
  7. Provide monthly reporting on client activity and growth

Skills

  1. Great time management skills
  2. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects at the same time
  3. Experience managing Google Ads, Facebook ads (including Instagram).
  4. Understanding of all types of advertising including search, display, social, and remarketing
  5. Ability to create reporting based on KPIs and goals
  6. Knowledge of tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and SEMrush
  7. Familiarity with call tracking software like CallRail
  8. Passion for learning and growth

items.title: Telecommute Anatomy and Physiology I and II Expert
items.content: An eLearning curriculum development company is filling a position for a Telecommute Anatomy and Physiology I and II Expert.Core Responsibilities Include: Designing, developing, and authoring Anatomy & Physiology I & II digital coursesContributing to other projects as neededQualifications for this position include:Experience in instructional designFamiliarity with Blooms TaxonomyDegree in Nursing, Biology, Biomedical Sciences, or closely related fieldHigher education teaching and/or content development experience

items.title: Paid Social/Search Campaign Manager
items.content:
Remote | International

About TRGT

We are 42 of the best digital marketers from around the world, operating remotely to run market leading performance campaigns on Facebook, Instagram and Google for some of the most exciting, high-growth companies out there.

About the role

Running Facebook and Adwords campaigns for a rapidly growing and highly successful remote digital marketing agency. Working with our Performance Directors you will be responsible for daily management, analysis and optimization of campaigns. As you gain experience the scope of the role will expand with you taking on more and more client management, driving strategy on top of the execution of the campaigns.

You will get the opportunity to work with 2-5 different clients at any given time, all presenting unique and interesting challenges. You will also get to collaborate with and learn from multiple people within the business on a daily basis. We want you to become an integral member of the team and help us deliver best in industry service levels to our clients.

Day to Day Tasks 

  • Work with the Performance Director to define the approach for the account based on the goals of the client
  • Analyse and optimize campaigns to drive changes in performance
  • Report to clients and handle some of the day to day communications
  • Provide recommendations for how to improve the campaigns, innovating on the current set up

Required Experience

  • Minimum 18 months of experience running direct response marketing campaigns on a biddable platform (Paid social, Search)
  • A proven track record of hitting targets and executing your work to a very high standard
  • Need to have worked a lot with excel, experience with either macros or coding a bonus

Desired Qualities 

  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to operate autonomously
  • Strong numeracy and communication skills
  • Self-motivated
  • Fast learner
  • Proactive

Benefits 

  • Fully remote working means you can work from wherever you want, no commute and no ties to any particular location
  • Work with some of the best digital marketers in the industry and a range of exciting, high-growth companies
  • Unlimited holiday. Yes, we don’t have a cap on holiday
  • Competitive salary based on experience and the opportunity to grow and progress quickly through the ranks

Apply to: info@trgtdigital.com

Apply for job

items.title: Product Manager - Mobile/Web Apps
items.content:
RAISINI, a 21 Year old global Creative, Entertainment & Marketing Agency and Dubai's 1st House Record Label and a Music Publishing Company, is launching a Lifestyle Membership SuperApp 'Havn' [Heaven] disrupting the Lifestyle industry, and make life a lot easier for individuals and the Hospitality industry, saving them TIME & MONEY while offering experiences that create unforgettable memories.


Only the very best talent gets in to Havn!


We are now looking for a proactive and ambitious Product Manager (Mobile/Web App) to join the team here at Havn.


The current team consist of over 25 Super Heroes from around the world (13 countries) and we are just getting started!


What Does Success Look Like In This Role:



  • As a Product Manager you’ll work closely with members in the product management team, such as Product Managers, Product Owners, and Product Designers.

  • As a Product Manager helps ensure that necessary steps are being taken across business functions (product, strategy, engineering team) to bring out the best results for the business.

  • Collaborate  closely with Engineering, Design, UI/UX, Product Owners, Scrum Master, Agile Coach and Business Development, Marketing and Operations– to successfully develop, launch, and realize revenue goals for products.

  • As a Product Manager will work within an agile software development team to track competitors’ and market tendencies; manage a product roadmap that involves marketing, customers and partners;

  • Assist in Identifying and evaluating new market opportunities. Create business cases, level of effort estimates, and go-to-market strategies for chosen opportunities.

  • Proactively defining and driving new horizontal technology partnerships and expands existing new solutions and customer use cases and scenarios.

  • Developing deep understandings of internal and external customer segments and driving product and partnership strategy and providing direction that translate into high value features and customer wins.

  • Managing dependencies and work with the Product Owner to identify and manage the backlog items;

  • Align various stakeholders (marketing, operations, data analytics, etc.) on delivery scope (releases) and in preparation for launch

  • Support strategic discussions on the future direction of the product and user experience

  • Act as the product expert, customer advocate and liaison between your customers and Product Management & Design team to translate business requirements into product enhancements.

  • Conduct project management

  • Conduct regular status calls with customers to identify concerns and areas of opportunity and to provide updates on tracked issues and requests.

  • Maintain issue, project, and enhancement priority and status lists for each customer on their account dashboard.

  • Improve Customer Experience & Customer Satisfaction

  • Lead strategic, cross-functional initiatives such as customer journeys, maturity models, voice-of-customer, and product feedback

  • Provide feedback to CEO, CTO, Business Development and Marketing on patterns you see with Customers that will allow us to more efficiently scale our business


Bonus if you have experience with:



  • design

  • UX

  • managing remote teams

  • making data-informed decisions

  • startups

  • building cool things


Requirements



  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent related experience

  • 8-10+ years in a Product Owner / Product Manager with experience in customer-facing roles. Candidates looking to take a step up into Product Management in an early startup environment will be considered.

  • Agile advocate, working in high-performing Agile teams.

  • Ability to understand, simplify, and communicate technical and business process concepts to customers and colleagues

  • Strong customer service skills

  • Strong critical thinking skills

  • Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills

  • Ability to take ownership of tasks

  • Ability to work equally as well on a team or independently

  • Self-motivated with a strong work ethic

  • Comfortable in a fast-moving environment

  • Ability to multitask and adapt

  • Exceptional communication skills

  • Problem analysis and problem-solving skills

  • Judgment and decision-making ability

  • Initiative

  • Professionalism and confidentiality

  • Attention to detail and accuracy

  • Flexibility

  • Strong verbal communication and interpersonal skills

  • Passion for Havn and the mission of the company


---------------------------------------


Why Join RAISINI.Com


---------------------------------------



  • You will be part of a company that will disrupt an entire industry

  • We provide a fun and entrepreneurial working environment within an exciting high-growth startup business, where you can use your talent to make a real difference.

  • This is a rare opportunity to build a truly global product from the ground up, and join early a startup that will soon be a growing business of exceptional engineers working on the latest technologies.

  • You will gain first-hand experience in building an AI-powered mobile application and delivering it to the end users.

  • You will work side-by-side with the CEO/Founder who might take you out surfing or partying in St. Tropez from time to time.

  • After funding, we will be offering a very competitive remuneration package, flexible hours, generous holiday allowance, regular social events and many other perks we continue adding as the company grows.


IMPORTANT NOTES:


*This is an unpaid role until we are funded and launched this summer. You must understand and decide whether this would be the right set up for you.


Havn received 100s of CVs every day, so if you haven’t heard back from us within 28 days, sadly your application perhaps hasn’t been successful at this time.

items.title: Medicare agent wanted- free lead generation, remote work, paid 3x per day
items.content:
Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform and uncap your earnings on the industry’s best work from home Medicare sales platform, selling Medicare Advantage, Supplement, and Prescription Drug plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

 

We have just opened up 500 spots nationally for experienced Medicare agents to join our platform by May 29th.Spots are filling up fast! COVID-19 is changing the way all Medicare is sold, but Assurance was built from the ground up as a next-generation solution for times like these.

 

Join the ASSURANCE platform, and take advantage of:

  • 100% remote;, you log in when you’re ready to sell.
  • Assurance pays both commissions and production bonuses. There are no caps on how much you can make, and top ASSURANCE agents earn over $200,000 in compensation annually.
  • Free calls via inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites, television commercials, and direct mail. Our Guides prospect calls and transfer interested and qualified prospect to you.
  • Access to our proprietary billion-dollar software platform at no cost to you. The platform has all the tools to empower you to succeed!
  • Contract with leading national carriers such as Humana, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare, and more.


You are in total control as you work remotely from the comfort of your home or office. Calls are always flowing on the ASSURANCE platform; when you log in you are put in front of interested consumers ready to talk to you. You’re not spending time prospecting and appointment setting, buying your own leads to dial, or sitting in a call center for 8 hours per day waiting for the phone to ring. You are your ownboss and you’re surrounded online by other top performers just like you.


The Assurance system has eliminated industry inefficiencies and will provide you with free training & scripting, back office accounting & customer service, tech support, recommendation and quoting engines, and custom analytics on your performance. Now you see why we were called “the Uber of insurance” when we were acquired by Prudential Financial (NYSE: PRU) for $3.5B in 2019.

Requirements to access ASSURANCE Medicare platform as 1 of 500 elite producers:

  • AHIP certification
  • 3+ insurance state licenses
  • High-speed Internet, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice

  • Assurance pays both commissions and production bonuses. There are no caps on how much you can make, and top ASSURANCE agents earn over $200,000 in compensation annually.
  • Free calls via inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites, television commercials, and direct mail. Our Guides prospect calls and transfer interested and qualified prospect to you.
  • Access to our proprietary billion-dollar software platform at no cost to you. The platform has all the tools to empower you to succeed!
  • Contract with leading national carriers such as Humana, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare, and more.


You are in total control as you work remotely from the comfort of your home or office. Calls are always flowing on the ASSURANCE platform; when you log in you are put in front of interested consumers ready to talk to you. You’re not spending time prospecting and appointment setting, buying your own leads to dial, or sitting in a call center for 8 hours per day waiting for the phone to ring. You are your ownboss and you’re surrounded online by other top performers just like you.


The Assurance system has eliminated industry inefficiencies and will provide you with free training & scripting, back office accounting & customer service, tech support, recommendation and quoting engines, and custom analytics on your performance. Now you see why we were called “the Uber of insurance” when we were acquired by Prudential Financial (NYSE: PRU) for $3.5B in 2019.

Requirements to access ASSURANCE Medicare platform as 1 of 500 elite producers:

  • AHIP certification
  • 3+ insurance state licenses
  • High-speed Internet, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice

items.title: REMOTE CERNER SURGINET ANALYST
items.content:
CTG is seeking a Cerner PeriOP Analyst for a remote opportunity, supporting the SurgiNet and Anesthesia modules.

Job responsibilities will include:

• Provide application support services for Cerner SurgiNet and Anesthesia

• Analyze service requests, and make recommendations related to best practices

• Follow client’s documented Demand Management process to obtain approval for changes.

• Build application changes in Test, work with user to complete testing, and move to production according to the client’s change control process.

• Provide support for projects and other special application initiatives

• Troubleshoot complex user errors and provide timely and high quality customer service

• Document issues and solutions

• Participate in the day to day tracking and follow-up on issues and questions of daily operations.

• Validate and support system testing efforts

• Work with client users and functional teams as needed

• Escalate issues to the vendor as needed, and monitor vendor tickets for resolution

• Utilize the ticket management system to track issue status and work volume

• Participate in a 24/7 after hours on call rotation

After an initial Knowledge Transfer period of 2 to 4 weeks at the client site, work will be performed remotely.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

5+ years’ experience in support and build of Cerner SurgiNet and Anesthesia

Excellent troubleshooting skills, with the ability to communicate resolutions to customers

Prefer prior experience working remotely to provide production support

In depth knowledge of OR workflows required; Surgical Tech, RN or other clinical experience

Other Comments:

These are Tier 3 positions – analysts should have strong build and troubleshooting expertise in the Cerner module identified. Experience in multiple Cerner modules is highly preferred.

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) has developed a reputation for responsiveness and reliability - traits that our clients say set us apart - since our founding in 1966. As one team, we create and deliver information and technology solutions that make our clients more successful and cultivate a workplace that attracts and develops the best people. Our vision is to be an indispensable partner to our clients and the preferred career destination for information and technology experts. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India and regularly posts news and other important information online at www.ctg.com.

Our culture is a direct result of the people who work at CTG, the values we hold, and the actions we take. In other words, our people are the culture. It's a living, breathing thing that is renewed every day through the ways we engage with each other, our clients, and our communities. Part of our mission is to cultivate a workplace that attracts and develops the best people, reflected by our recognition as a Great Place to Work-certified company across many of our global operations.

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. CTG will assure equal opportunity and consideration to all applicants and employees in recruitment, selection, placement, training, benefits, compensation, promotion, transfer, and release of individuals without regard to race, creed, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, age, disability, marital or veteran status, citizenship status, or any other discriminatory factors as required by law. Our Affirmative Action program serves to promote occupational equality and diversity through good faith efforts. CTG is fully committed to promoting employment opportunities for members of protected classes.

Additional Information

Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years)

Work Remote: Yes

Travel: No

items.title: Analytics Engineer Javascript
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=30, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=20}
items.content:
InfoTrust

Analytics Engineer Javascript

Are you looking for your next technical challenge? Do you love learning more about how things work, reviewing code, and debugging JavaScript? Would you like an opportunity to help build scalable tag management and analytics systems for some of the largest websites in the world? Are you known as the team member who gets things done? If so, then this might be the ideal role for you! InfoTrust, a digital analytics technology and consulting company, works with many of the largest brands in the world across the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), News + Media and eCommerce industries. Our goal is to simplify the lives of marketers while helping them confidently make data-backed decisions that increase their ROI, improve their customer lifetime value and turn them into marketing gurus, none of which is possible without a technical backbone! Because of InfoTrust's growth we are currently looking for a technologist who is interested in becoming an authority in analytics and digital marketing to help our clients build that backbone. As an Analytics Engineer at InfoTrust you will: * Join our awesome consulting team where you’ll learn first-hand about the world of digital analytics,  * Become a master at advanced digital analytics solutions * Work alongside clients to help them implement advanced analytic systems; even better, you’ll get a chance to work with some of the largest CPG, Media and e-commerce websites in the world on establishing executive level measurement strategies, and building and supporting analytics architectures across a variety of platforms such as Google Analytics, Adobe Launch, AWS, and Tealium * Troubleshoot issues with digital analytics web tagging implementations, and advanced solution analytics architectures * Prototype, and possibly even code, solutions to integrate digital web analytics platforms data with other platforms, using technologies such as BigQuery and/or Analytics Reporting APIs  * Help automate the management and auditing of enterprise analytics systems * Develop data integration solutions and work with cloud technologies to deliver realtime/scalable analytics solutions * Full-stack development, experience leading Node-JS solutions in Google Cloud technologies * Leveraging Management APIs to automate bulk changes across Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager systems * Automating collection of Google Analytics data for client reporting and dashboards * Technical support on dedicated assigned projects * Never stop learning. InfoTrust is always growing to exceed our clients expectations, being industry thought leaders.  Requirements What background does the successful Analytics Engineer have: * You are experience in Javascript, Java and/or Python, and have 3+ years of supporting projects with full stack development * You have experience with Node.js and jquery * You have a good understanding of web technologies and frameworks * You have experience with Software Development Life Cycle, and Agile methodology * You have experience working with Cloud Technologies, and have used Cloud technologies in your previous projects. Bonus - specific experience with GCP.  * You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment and overcoming technical and business challenges * You enjoy learning new technologies, languages, and services. We frequently are developing new services and thus are constantly evolving the technology stack. * You are often the person that is relied on to “get things done” or, someone might say “give to YOUR NAME (s)he will get it done!” * You get a thrill out of working in a collaborative environment and feel our core values (Impact, Diversity, Respect, Innovation, Growth and Ownership) line up with yours Nice to haves: * You have worked with, or have a desire to work with digital analytics, such as Google Analytics * Experience with Cloud services such as Google Cloud Platform * Experience with Full Stack Development (Node.js preferred) Location: This role is based in the US. Our HQ is in Cincinnati, OH. We also have office locations in Chicago, IL and Columbus, OH. We will give preference to people close to these locations, but also are considering remote employees. Must be authorized to work in the US for any employer.  More about InfoTrust: If you are looking for a company with a great culture, that can help you to grow as a professional, and help to feel personal success, InfoTrust would like to take that journey with you. We have been awarded as a great place to work -- at a national and regional level, this includes Ad Age's Best Places to Work, Great places to Work Certification, #1 Employer in Ohio, and much more. But we know that we could not achieve these accolades without our amazing team, and without growing that team with more great people that match our culture. A culture rooted in innovation, teamwork, respect, growth and ownership. The great benefits we offer are a huge perk too; Benefits include: * Free lunch and snacks everyday * Unlimited PTO * Flexible work hours * Fantastic Parental Leave policy * Employer-paid health, dental and vision insurance for you and your dependents * Gym reimbursement * Tuition and continued education reimbursement * And much, much more! Capped by wonderful coworkers InfoTrust is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate applicants regardless of an individual’s age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

items.title: Evergreen Supply: E-Commerce & Conversion Rate Optimization Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=1}
items.content:
E-Commerce & Conversion Rate Optimization Manager

Hi there -- we're excited to meet you!

Our Company: 
We're a rapidly growing outdoor sporting goods and clothing company. We design, manufacture, market and sell our own brands on Amazon.com. We are a market leader in many product categories such as sleeping bags, cots, ski gloves, ski goggles, running gloves, stand up paddles, surfing accessories, headwear and more. 

Responsibilities:
We’re looking for a highly quantitative, analytical, creative, curious and proactive person to join as our E-Commerce & Conversion Rate Manager. In particular, we’re looking for someone to optimize the conversion rates of our 100+ products on Amazon in a scalable way.
 
This role is highly multi-disciplinary, requiring you to wear several hats:
  • Product Manager: you’ll have to understand all our products and the various demographics that buy them
  • Business Analyst: you’ll have to go through our sales, conversion rate and traffic reports every week to identify struggling products, areas for improvement and sales trends
  • Creative Director & Copy Editor: you’ll go through our products on Amazon, looking for opportunities to improve conversion rates through better model/lifestyle photos, videos and copywriting
  • Project Manager: you may set the vision and help manage large photo/video shoots of our products as we seek to improve the quality and conversion rates of all our listings

Here are a few specific things you will work on:
  • Track our products’ conversion rates and traffic by week and month, take action when necessary. Example: one of our sleeping bag's sales dropped 25% Y/Y. Why is this happening? Is this a traffic or conversion rate issue?
  • Prioritize products based on their sales and conversion rate potential improvement. 
  • Approve/edit/test copy: take the existing copy and edit/approve it. The copy should be a mix between informative, somewhat entertaining/personable, benefits (not features) oriented and keyword rich. 
  • Continuously split test our images and copy to optimize conversion rates (note: we use splitly.com for our Amazon A/B testing)
  • Understand each product's customer demographics. Example: we found that an older demographic buys our white arm sleeves (for sun protection) while a younger demo buys our black sleeves (for sports like basketball and football). How do we appeal to each demographic? 
  • Communicate issues with the Sales & Marketing & Creative teams to solve issues. Example: based on the competition, here are a few ideas on how we can improve conversion rates on this product
  • Ask the creative team to callout features about our product in the listing images. Example: many customer reviews rave about the sweatband liner on this hat. Can we add a photo of this sweatband? 
  • Identify ways to improve our listings. Example: customers keep asking about whether this product works with soft-top surfboards. Can we include this in the listing? 
  • Understand how the Amazon ranking algorithm works — the algorithm is an ever-changing black box. We must understand it as much as possible in order to maximize conversion rates
  • Track our product’s keyword rankings on Amazon to understand which searches are driving the most revenue for us on Amazon. What keywords are driving the revenue for us? On which keywords do we have to be #1 to maximize profit?
Your Experience at the Company: 
  • You'll work directly with the CEO and Director of Operations
  • You will have access to all our sales and profitability reporting
  • You must be okay with morning or late evening calls to talk with the team in the Philippines or on the US East Coast
  • You will meet with your teammates 4 times per year in the Philippines. Here's our company structure: 15 in PH, 3 in the US (including CEO), 2 in China, 1 in the UK 
    • Creative team (4): graphic design, product/packaging design, photo shoots, video shoot speccing 
    • Sales & Marketing (5): listing optimization, keyword research, PPC advertising, display advertising, copywriting, SEO partnerships 
    • Branding & Marketing (1): high-level branding, guidance on product listings 
    • Customer Happiness (3): customer support, handwritten letters to customers 
    • Development (2): automating processes, scraping data, providing data-driven insights 
    • Strategy & Operations (2): business analytics, forecasting, sales analysis, inventory management 
    • China team (2): sourcing, manufacturing, quality control, vendor management, logistics 
Traits / Experience We're Looking for: 
  • Experience in e-commerce management and conversion rate optimization
  • Extremely proactive and communicative
  • Extremely quantitative and analytical: amazing with Excel, possible experience with other data analysis tools like Tableau or Chart.io 
  • Curious and eager to learn 
  • Friendly and personable, yet ﬁrm and able to keep others accountable 
  • Operations experience a multi-million dollar revenue business 
  • Experience in Amazon, e-commerce, digital marketing (SEO/SEM), operations is a huge plus 
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum and Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS) as those are the systems we use 
  • Hard working: Must be willing and able to work up to 60 hours per week occasionally
  • Travel: will travel to the Philippines 4x per year for our quarterly Get Togethers. You might also travel to Puerto Rico and locations across the US to attend conferences. You may also take trips to China to visit/understand our manufacturing and supply chain operations (unfortunately, this is on hold for the time being due to the pandemic).
Salary & Benefits: 
  • Pay: $4000+ USD per month depending on experience and skills with 10% year-end target bonus
  • Employer-reimbursed health insurance up to $200 per month
  • 21 days paid time off
  • Remote work, no commute: work from the comfort of your home, local coffee shop or resort.  
    Fast, reliable internet is an absolute must.
  • References: 3-5 necessary
Interested?

If you're interested in this job, please send us the following information:
  • Your favorite business books and podcasts 
  • Your favorite outdoors activity/sport and your most memorable outdoors trip 
  • How we can we improve the listings below (images, copy, Enhanced Brand Content, video, branding)? The more specific you can be, the better. 
    • https://www.amazon.com/Face-Mask-Protection-Breathable-12/dp/B00Q2L776G/ 
    • https://www.amazon.com/Mens-Headband-Dominating-Competition-Performance/dp/B01G4RQCF4/ 
    • https://www.amazon.com/Tough-Headwear-Balaclava-Snowboarding-Motorcycling/dp/B019F18TX4 
    • https://www.amazon.com/Tough-Outdoors-Large-Organizer-Storage/dp/B071K5CXHL 
    • https://www.amazon.com/Winter-Snowboard-Gloves-Wrist-Leashes/dp/B073XNSKSG/ 
  • We have 8 SKUs of ski gloves/mittens. How would you go about optimizing this category of products? Would you optimize them one by one or several at once? How would you decide? What metrics would you consider?
  • Your experiences (written, video, audio) about how your past experiences have prepared you for the responsibilities of this job 
  • Resume including 3-5 references
We can't wait to meet you!

items.title: Growth SEO
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
**What is VEED.IO?**


Me (Sabba) and my co-founder Tim started VEED, an online video editing app just over a year ago. Since then we have grown much faster than we expected, about 40% every month! Thousands of influencers, brands, schools, artists, and podcasters create content on our platform every day. Hey, you might even know some of them :) We are a bootstrapped company (NO VC's) and have always been public about our revenue, growth and failure. 


**We are looking for**


We are looking for an SEO writer with a solid understanding of content creation since were an online video editor.


We already have a strong organic presence, but we are only scratching the surface. We are looking for someone to help realise our organic potential and help us grow from 200,000 MAU to over a million. 


We need someone who knows how to find keyword opportunities. Someone who can create, maintain and improve content. Someone who can think strategically and also execute on opportunities fast. Someone who is driven and eager to learn! 
 
We know that not everyone fits into boxes, so don't worry too much... but here is a rough list of what we are looking for :)


Excellent understanding of the core fundamentals of SEO


At least 2 years of digital marketing and SEO experience in the online industry


A basic framework for tracking and reporting on-page ranking progress. 


Excellent written skills


Analytical skills to help work optimise and test content and layouts 


Bonus point for webflow & knowing what the F*** the "Jobs to be done" framework is and why it relates to search. 


We are aware that SEO is not an overnight success. So we are committed to giving you the freedom and autonomy to do your best work. But most importantly, we want someone who loves what they do and enjoys doing it.


**Where, when how?**


Work remotely?


Work from home with your dog?


Bring the dog into the office?


Need a few days off?


Work part-time in the office?


Work in a cafe?


Swap a weekday for a weekend?


Working a half-day?


All of the above is 100% good for us! Our entire team is remote (and always has been). We are happy as long your happy. You will have the freedom and autonomy you need to make decisions and do your best work. Our team is smart, young, and extremely talented and driven. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we all love what we do.
 
OH one more thing! We would really encourage applications from female applicants! Our team is diverse and we want to keep it that way :)

items.title: Demand Generation & Marketing
items.content:
We’re TEAMED and are launching an innovative HR product to enable growing companies to employ talents anywhere in the world, without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. We combine on-the-ground structures and technology to efficiently handle local compliance, payroll and benefits for our customers.


We are looking for an experienced Demand Generation & Marketing specialist to generate interest and highly qualified leads for our Sales team to convert and close.


This is a really exciting opportunity for someone to get involved in shaping how we do Demand Generation and to grow with the organisation. You'll be empowered to be creative, innovative and test new ideas whilst ensuring tried and tested marketing techniques are deployed.


What we expect from you:



  • Own all Demand Generation and Marketing activities in line with business development strategies.

  • Deploy Demand Generation through various channels - inbound/outbound, social media, website, campaigns, events, to build a continuous pipeline of qualified leads. This is yours to own and select the appropriate channels.

  • Ensure strategies and tactics are integrated and ROI and success can be measured, adjusting as necessary to ensure continuous improvement. 

  • Develop and promote relevant content for your demand generation strategy acting as either content writer, curator, or both and working closely with both internal and external stakeholders.

  • Use data analytics to gauge ROI on all campaigns, and on all online assets.


Some of the reasons we’ll love you:



  • You are exceptionally hands-on

  • You are an autonomous and ambitious professional. Someone who will get their hands dirty from day 1 whilst building the foundation for a scalable Demand Generation function.

  • You have experience working in B2B, ideally with HR functions as decision makers.

  • Bonus points if you have knowledge or experience with Payroll, HRIS, time-attendance, recruitment products

  • You are Digital & Technology savvy - strong grasp of demand generation technologies to support and automate

  • You have track records of generating qualified leads and contributing to the sales pipeline and revenue growth.

  • You can demonstrate experience of creating a fully integrated, measurable, Demand Generation strategy

  • You are creative and innovative - new ideas are very welcome!

  • You have experience of building social and content engagement tactics and strategies.

  • You are self-confident, excellent communicator both written and verbal


Some reasons you’ll love us:



  • We are early stage, so you have a big opportunity to make an impact.

  • We are a friendly, talented, collaborative and entrepreneurial team.

  • We provide a diverse, inclusive and creative environment where everyone's ideas and opinions are equally valued.

  • We offer a flexible work and vacation policy. We value your wellbeing and time off. For real.

  • We want all our employees to grow, so we support training opportunities and new ideas.

  • You’ll be entitled to stock options after 3 months, based on performance.

items.content:
Medicare Insurance Agent – Industry-best comp plan, total work freedom

Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform, and earn from the industry’s best comp plan, selling trusted Medicare plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

Get paid before, during, and after AEP. During AEP, we offer service fee commissions and bonuses, just for helping shoppers. Then after AEP, enjoy the largest January payout you’ve ever seen.

Work as an independent, remote, contract agent. Enjoy the freedom of working when you want, from wherever you want, helping inbound, qualified, in-market shoppers – all free to you.

Access our system, and eliminate agency inefficiencies and waste with free training, admin, support, product recommendations, and analytics. It’s like Uber for insurance!

After AEP, sell MediGap, health, or life, all year-round.

Join the ASSURANCE agent network, and take advantage of these benefits:

  • Free live, active, inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated sites
  • Access to our proprietary system (includes no dialing, product recommendations, analytics, and constant platform improvement), at no cost to you
  • Well-known and trusted carriers
  • 100s of Guides prospecting for you
  • Accessible underwriters
  • A+ BBB-accredited and proven

Requirements to access ASSURANCE platform:

  • AHIP certification
  • 12+ life insurance state licenses
  • One year of phone sales experience
  • High speed Internet connection, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • Thorough understanding of HIPAA privacy and security laws, DNC, and insurance regulatory laws
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice
  • Working space and equipment that comply with HIPAA privacy and security standards

About ASSURANCE:

Everyone is unique. But insurance plans are not.

Too often, plans offer blanket coverage, charging customers for coverage they don’t need while not offering enough of what they do.

ASSURANCE celebrates individual uniqueness with our personalized approach to seeking and purchasing insurance. Our platform serves as the intersection between customer and seller, technology and the human touch.

We start by asking customers a few questions to learn about their needs. From there, our ground-breaking, proprietary platform analyzes the thousands of data points that make customers unique. This is how we create custom-tailored plans for each and every kind of customer; plans built precisely for their needs and budget.

Our team of engineers, data scientists, marketers, architects, and designers are building systems using advanced science to make humans better. We’re eliminating insurance industry waste and simplifying the complex.

While our technology helps us personalize coverage, our network of experienced agents is how we deliver the right insurance to our customers.

All ASSURANCE Medicare agents are 1099, independent contractors and have maximum control over how, where, and when they do their work. ASSURANCE simply provides the tools to make your business as successful as possible.

Join ASSURANCE as we reimagine the role of insurance and enhance the personal and financial health of all consumers.

items.title: Circa Interactive: Digital Business Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Digital Business Analyst

Circa Interactive is passionate about establishing a new way of thinking in enrollment marketing. By amplifying a university’s unique story, executing data-driven paid advertising campaigns, leveraging innovative technology and working with faculty members to inspire content creation, we connect colleges and universities with the students who will help change our world and push forward big ideas.

There is an incredible demand for this way of thinking in higher education, and we are growing fast. Our clients include some of the top institutions in the U.S. and the world, and we are looking for the best of the best to join our team, teach us new things and help us deliver even more value to our academic partners. 

Why We Need You

Since 2011, Circa has developed a reputation as innovative, dependable and always willing to go above and beyond for our partners. As we grow, it is more important than ever that we focus on these areas, and doing so requires amazing people who also are innovative, dependable and willing to go above and beyond. We are a culture that values experience and knowledge, and we need someone who can make an immediate impact and help us continue delivering a high-quality experience that exceeds expectations.

As the digital business analyst, you will play a vital role in ensuring Circa exceeds the goals and expectations of our partner institutions. You are an experienced digital marketing pro and have the ability to translate client goals into a multi-dimensional enrollment marketing strategy that achieves cost per lead, cost per enrollment and student goals. You understand the enrollment funnel and have the ability to guide our university partners on everything from lead and enrollment forecasting to strategies to increase lead to student conversion rates. You will set the direction for the entire unit and your expertise will be critical to the success of each partnership.

This is a full-time role in San Diego and we are happy to help new employees relocate. We will also entertain a remote option if we find the right candidate.

Responsibilities

Main Objectives: Within the Analytics team, the digital business analyst will provide analytics and marketing technology expertise.  The digital business analyst will work through various analytics technology tasks/projects at the requests of the Director of Analytics & Digital Strategy and the Analytics Lead.  This individual will also assist the partnership managers, subject matter experts (Paid Media, SEO, PR) and leadership in order to help achieve the overall KPIs for each partner university.  He/she will initially research and select an effective data warehouse/data mart and provide a long-term solution for BI reporting working closely with the Analytics Lead.  The digital business analyst will provide additional analytics/marketing technology support as explained below.
  • As the digital business analyst, you will: 
    • Build a brand new data warehouse/data lake solution for digital analytics with focus on Paid Media, SEO, & Digital PR and incorporating CRM down-funnel enrollment data 
    • Collaborate with key stakeholders and data analysts to provide innovative BI solutions/deliverables for customer-centric analytics 
    • Research and consider a DMP solution to integrate 1st party and 3rd party data 
    • Manage multi-channel attribution modeling process/reporting to build customer journey maps and understand the whole customer experience 
    • Collect internal and external business requirements and provide relevant reporting and dashboards with the help of our data analysts 
    • Setup/manage Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Hotjar, etc. and provide relevant reports to the team for actionable insights 
    • Work closely with our data analysts to understand marketing and enrollment results for various programs 
    • Work with data analysts to setup AWS SFTP processes for lead files exports and enrollment files imports 
    • Work closely with our CRO consultant to setup and test program landing pages and web pages 
    • Assist in marketing technology tasks -- Unbounce landing page forms CRM integrations, Facebook/LinkedIn Lead Form Ads CRM integrations using Zapier, tags/pixels (including event-tracking) setup and QA 
    • Join monthly client and business unit strategy meetings and ad hoc strategy meetings as needed 
    • Stay up-to-date on the current trends in digital marketing and higher ed. 
    • Understanding and intermediate-level ability to conduct practical market research and industry analysis 
    • Additional relevant projects or tasks for the Analytics team 
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree (Master’s Degree preferred) in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Economics, Math, Statistics, or a related field of study.
  • Critical thinker who understands business requirements and can provide relevant reporting/analyses to provide actionable insights to our digital marketing subject matter experts, partnership managers, leadership, etc.   
  • Projected project management and/or development of a data warehouse/data mart or similar technology integration.
  • Advanced experience with web analytics and reporting tools focused on telling stories through data (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Hotjar).
  • 1+ years focused on web analytics and/or business analytics.
  • Analyze marketing performance issues -- data mining to provide effective reporting showing wins and opportunities.
  • Business Modeling: spreadsheet modeling and data visualization.
  • Digital Enterprise: CRM system (Salesforce, Hubspot, Recruit, Slate, etc.) integrations with digital platforms.
  • Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills: VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Macros, etc.
  • Higher education industry experience preferred.
  • Remote Possibility; preferably, San Diego or Orlando.
Preferred Skills

Excel (advanced modeling), Google Sheets (advanced modeling), Supermetrics, AdStage, Zapier, Google Marketing Platform (Google Data Studio, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Optimize), Digital Media Platform Analytics (Google Ads, Bing Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads), Hotjar, Unbounce, Instapages, AWS, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, SQL, SAS, R, Python

Salary range: [$55-65k/year]

Benefits of Working at Circa
  • Learning stipend of $1,500 per year
  • Unlimited vacation days
  • Health, dental, vision and life insurance
  • 401k + match
  • Career mapping and planning
  • Up to eight training and development opportunities per month
  • Continuous performance feedback and learning opportunities
  • Weekly and monthly team lunches and events
About Circa Interactive

Through innovative, creative and analytical solutions, our mission is to help higher education institutions achieve their marketing and student enrollment goals as efficiently and effectively as possible. We are committed to preserving brand integrity, amplifying program awareness, building thought leadership and generating high-quality inquiries for our partner institutions.

Visit circaedu.com to learn more.

Please note: only applicants located in the United States will be considered.

Send an email to apply: shannon@circaedu.com

items.title: Do It! Marketing: Marketing Manager
items.content:
Marketing Manager

Who we are:
We are Do It! Marketing (www.doitmarketing.com) and the creator of The Speaker Profit Formula (www.SpeakerProfitFormula.com), our flagship mentoring and coaching program. Our team helps people from around the world market their expertise as a paid professional speaker AND all the accompanying revenue streams such as coaching, consulting, training, facilitation, online courses, licensing, sponsorships, and more - both virtually and in person.

We’re hiring a world-class marketer and leader to help us expand to our next level of marketplace success using both paid and organic traffic, email marketing, content marketing, online communities, video, live streaming, direct mail, and live events (we are open to other ideas you may have as well).

This is a full-time role that will require 35-45 hours per week. It's okay if you've got other projects going on the side, but working for us has got to be your primary commitment.

How we work:
Do It! Marketing is a fully remote team of self-starters.  We are committed and passionate about positively impacting the lives of our clients.

If you’re looking for a role within a team that feels like a family and that will allow you to do amazing work at an exciting period of growth, look no further. 

As part of a remote team, we’re looking for someone that can live by our values (ask to see a list of our values).

The Job:
The purpose of the Marketing Manager is to develop and own the outcomes from all our online and offline marketing strategies and initiatives. 

The primary outcomes you’ll be measured on are: lead quantity, lead quality, and ultimately, helping us hit our highly aggressive sales growth goals.  

You’ll pay particular attention to top-of-funnel lead generation and optimization of pipeline conversion rates. 

You will use your broad skill set to present new ideas and opportunities to help grow Do It! Marketing through new and existing channels and retargeting efforts.

Who you are:
You’re comfortable with both the creative and analytical aspects of growth marketing and enjoy bringing a vision to life, while being a stats geek so that you can detect the patterns behind the numbers to help us make actionable decisions in real time.

You’re an experienced marketer, always honing your craft, with the desire and ability to expand, develop and master new marketing skill sets and tools.

Your Experience:

Need to have:
  • Proven, measurable expertise in paid ads, focusing on Facebook, Google and YouTube.  You have successfully managed a five-figure per month ad spend - or close to it
  • Proven, measurable expertise in multiple forms of lead generation (aside from paid ads)
  • Funnel creation, management, and conversion optimization expertise
  • Knowledge of email marketing best practices including targeted lists, subject lines, messaging, deliverability and CAN-SPAM/anti-spam legislation, with a proven background in producing measurable results
  • Well-versed on direct marketing strategies and concepts (i.e. attribution, A/B testing, retention, etc.) across a multitude of marketing channels (email, direct mail, social, SEO/SEM, etc.)
  • Have experience in a combination of the following skills: web design, landing page design and creation (ClickFunnels, Leadpages, etc.), ad design and creation, and e­mail marketing
  • Can plan AND execute a strategy. Identify weaknesses in existing marketing campaigns and develop pragmatic solutions within budgetary constraints
  • You’re prepared to jump in and get the job done yourself.  You don't need a team to produce immediate results
  • Are a natural problem solver.  If you don't know how to do something, you know how to identify appropriate resources to find a solution 
  • Excellent time management and project management skills
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Excellent communicator - verbally, visually and in writing.  You know how to get a message across
  • Growth mindset and “extreme ownership” of results
  • Effectively create, manage to, and report on KPIs
  • Remote work experience, bulletproof Wifi and connectivity

Nice to have:
  • Knowledge of SEO best practices and analytics reporting
  • Ability to effectively and measurably repurpose our multitudes of content
  • Knowledge of direct mail and copywriting
  • Knowledge of live streaming
  • Webinar creation and marketing expertise
  • Experience with video marketing and podcast marketing
  • Community management and growth (Facebook groups, etc.) and generating leads from those communities
  • Experience in making live events a success

At Do It! Marketing, we understand that super talented people don’t always fit the mold. 

We’re looking for A-Players ONLY to join our team. 

We encourage you to apply if you identify as such but you’re not 100% certain you “qualify” for the whole list above. 

If you’re a rock star marketer, you’ll know it - and so will we :o) 

To Apply:

Please record a short video (90 seconds max), answering the following questions:
  • On a scale of 1-10, how would you rate yourself on your ability to produce materially positive results from paid ads?
  • What is the largest monthly paid ads budget you have successfully managed for ONE client?
  • What do you believe is the most important KPI as it relates to paid ads?
  • Other than paid ads, what would you see as the top three lead generation tactics we should employ - in order of preference?
  • On a scale of 1-10, how would you rate yourself on your ability to produce sales from email marketing?
  • What’s the one thing that jumps out at you about our company?

Send the video link to charlie@doitmarketing.com with the subject line:
Fantastic Marketing Manager Info Inside...

Videos must be received by 8 May 2020.  We promise to respond to all video applicants.
 
Thanks, and we look forward to hearing from you!
 
Charlie

items.title: Product Marketing Executive
items.content:
NuVuw.com is a property design and project management platform for Architects, Interior designers, and Construction related small and medium business professionals.  Our cloud-based SaaS solution delivers end-to-end visibility and management control of new-build and renovation projects including collaboration for teams and clients.


The Role – Product Marketing Executive


This is an exciting volunteer role for a self-motivated and driven Product Marketing executive with a track record of success in brand and product positioning, content, and digital campaign marketing, to help the team define a clear strategy and execution plan.


Role Description


You will work together with our founder and be responsible for leading and executing product and brand awareness campaigns and content to drive volume targeted traffic to our website.


Location



  • We are based south coast based near Bournemouth.

  • This role will be remote / home-based until we are out of this lockdown environment.


Benefits



  • Flexible hours to suit those candidates currently under a furlough who are unable to work but would like to get involved for a few (or as many) hours a week to help keep NuVuw moving forward.

  • Opportunity for the right person to take a lead marketing role in NuVuw’s future once fully funded with equity on an ongoing basis post furlough.

  • Limited expenses will be covered

items.title: Clevertech : Jr. Product Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Jr. Product Analyst

Location: Only Considering Candidates Within the US and Canada [REMOTE]

DESCRIPTION:

Clevertech is looking for someone with an innate intellectual curiosity and great people skills to join our fully remote team as a Junior Product Analyst.

Our vision at Clevertech is to provide enterprises a world-class development team that executes on their most ambitious goals. We are looking for a team member to help us set the best practices and define success for various projects while working with Project Managers and other members of the product team.


REQUIREMENTS:

You have a consistently positive attitude and are interested in learning new things. Excellent communication (verbal and written), analytical, and interpersonal skills are your best strengths and you are able to work independently and within a team to take on new tasks as needed. Prioritization and organization will be key factors of success in this role. This is a position where experience is a plus, but a genuine interest in learning about new technologies will go a long way.

Experience Required:
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of professional full-time experience
  • Attention to Detail
  • Great communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships 
Who you are:
  • You have the ability to multitask and effectively prioritize.
  • Eagerness to learn.
  • Poised and professional demeanor with high intellectual curiosity.
  • You are energized by working in fast-paced environments.
  • You enjoy the challenge of solving dynamic problems.
  • Clients love you. You know what they want, sometimes before they do.
  • You are willing to travel, as needed.
  • Experience with the G Suite, GitHub, and ZenHub a plus.
  • We are not looking for UX/UI experience.

What you will do:

Your day will primarily consist of testing and analyzing web and mobile apps that are in active development to verify functionality, assist with managing ongoing projects, and assisting with client relationship management.


Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits:
  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community
  • Health care and 401k

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work



Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech's Career Growth Video

items.title: Senior Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote | International

Worldwide | Full-time | Allows remote

About the Role

The Senior Product Manager will join our growing PM team to lead both platform and native mobile initiatives with our US-based clients as well as new products that Whitespectre is developing. Significant experience with subscription-based models, ecommerce, and/or SaaS platforms is a plus.

This position can be performed remotely or from our offices in Barcelona. Our working hours are typically 11am to 8pm BCN time. Only candidates who are based outside of the US will be considered for this role.

This role requires excellent writing and presentation skills in English. Ideally, you are a native English speaker or have spent many years working with a US, UK, or Canada-based company.

In this role, you will:

  • Align with clients on key business goals and customer needs for each product initiative
  • Partner with executive-level stakeholders and the development team to define, deliver, and advance the roadmap
  • Own the evolution of the product from inception through launch and iteration
  • Define and communicate detailed user stories and lead the team’s grooming and sprint planning sessions
  • Work hand in hand with UI/UX designers and the development team to create engaging and dynamic user experiences
  • Use analytics, surveys, competitive analysis, and user interviews to identify areas of opportunity or improvement
  • Lead stakeholder meetings and communicate regularly with the Whitespectre executive team on progress and the client relationship

We work on fast iteration cycles and tight deadlines using an agile/scrum methodology. This job is ideal for PMs who are action-oriented, self-directed and enjoy a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment.

We’re excited about candidates who are:

  • Excellent collaborators and communicators. You consider the perspective and priorities of each stakeholder in advance when you communicate. You’re clear, specific, and engaging. You’re skilled at building trust and group alignment, even in tricky situations
  • Excellent organizers; able to catch and juggle competing priorities while understanding the bigger project management picture to make yourself and your team successful.
  • Intellectually curious and passionate about new products, emerging technologies, and new market opportunities.
  • Bring a strong eye for design and a human-centered approach to product development
  • Understand product marketing and the importance of a company’s brand and positioning in gaining both market share and customer loyalty
  • Seeking a long-term, growth opportunity. While our work is fast-paced, we also work consistent hours and value stability. If you’re a ‘Digital Nomad’ and/or looking for something short-term, then we’re not the right fit for you.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • At least 3+ years in a Product Management role, working daily with a development team
  • At least 1+ years of experience managing native mobile apps. Ideally, you have experience with both IOS and Android.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to craft strategy presentations as well as deliver updates for an executive audience.
  • Experience using analytics platforms and enough experience with data analysis to know how to track KPIs and what questions to ask

Why is it good to work with us?

We know that big ideas and big results only happen when you have the right people, working together smartly – whether that’s across the room or across the globe. We make work fun and rewarding.

Because we work on cool projects. Sure, we can list the latest set of technologies that we use, but that is a given. What’s more interesting is how they are used – the design, the architecture, the approach to solving business problems. And we do that across multiple clients – each and everyone we’re excited to work with.

Because we believe in constant learning and exploring – whether that’s a new skill, a new role, or a new way of seeing. And because we’ve found that we learn the most when we take on new challenges as a team. We’re proud that people love working with us (and still have lives outside of work).

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Growth Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Full Time – Remote

“Visme is one the world’s best visual content creation platforms, enabling millions of users, from students and teachers to non-profit organizations and fortune 500 companies such as teams from IBM, Capital One, TD Bank, Netflix, WorkDay, Sony, etc, to create captivating content in a matter of minutes, not hours.

We’re looking for a world-class Growth Marketing Manager to join our team and play a vital role to plan, implement, and optimize our growth marketing strategy.

Your goal is to help Visme attract more power users in each segment of the market (enterprise, SMBs, education, and individuals), make sure they have an awesome user journey, maximize paid conversions, and improve user retention. This role requires a deep understanding of online marketing and a proven track record (prior experience) with online brand(s) in particular with a SaaS product.

Seems like too much handle? Then perhaps you’re not the right fit.

Insights from the top

This role is the right fit if:

  • You have successfully implemented and scaled product marketing strategies at a SaaS platform with millions of users
  • Data-driven and results focussed. Must have prior experience with both quantitative and qualitative data — tracking, measuring and evaluating outcomes to demonstrate impact.
  • You’re an experienced content marketer, know on-page and off-page SEO in and out. We’re an exclusively inbound company.
  • You’ve extensively used the latest software tools such as Ahrefs, Google Analytics, Zapier, Pipedrive, and Zendesk.
  • You’re well-versed in paid advertising on various platforms. Know how not to rely on them but use them to your advantage at times.
  • You have experience launching SaaS products globally, and driving campaigns, communications, and go-to-market initiatives
  • Ability to think strategically (beyond just the moment), and synthesize all available information to come up with solutions with tangible impact.
  • You have a great eye for design and copy and how the two play together in order to achieve great campaigns.
  • You’re a hustler, this is not a 9-5 job. You’re a natural salesperson and know how to hit the right message for the right audience.

Things you’ll be doing

  • Managing and optimizing all communications with users through email, in-app, and paid ads
  • Coordinating with internal product teams, design, SEO, customer support, and PR & communications for product releases and announcements
  • Developing a comprehensive overview of the user journey and identify opportunities for optimizations at each step
  • Identify opportunities for increasing paid conversions and potential upselling of existing customers
  • Identifying common churn factors and optimizing retention strategies through other marketing channels and/or within the product
  • Optimizing the onboarding and training process of users in each segment of the market (enterprise, SMBs, education, and individuals)
  • Develop and grow Visme’s referral program to drive adoption of Visme within teams and organizations

Your qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or Communications or a related field
  • At least 4 real-world experience with a proven track record
  • Experience leading/coordinating with team members
  • Experience with WordPress, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, Google Adwords and other paid media
  • Experience working with a remote team

3 factors heavily weigh in our hiring decision for this position are:

  • Prior experience with growth and online marketing with online brands.
  • Highly dependable individual looking for long-term career opportunities.
  • Ability to solve challenging marketing problems through high-quality long-form content.
Apply for job

items.title: Business Analyst – Security
items.content:
Remote
  • (Multiple states)
  • Full Time
  • Solution Analysis & Design
  • Mid Level

InTouch Health is a leading telehealth solution company enabling remote physician care anytime, anywhere. Our solutions are robust, secure, and provide excellent physician-patient experiences to maximize care and minimize response time, and ensure the right doctor makes the right treatment decision every time.

Under the general direction of the VP of Solution Design, the Business Analyst will focus on providing security review documentation for our customers. Support pre-sales activities in the form of answering Security Questionnaires and Requests for Proposals (RFP’s) for sales teams; maintain customer facing documentation regarding network configuration of ITH products within customer networks and internal database; support multiple project requests, prioritize effectively and communicate well and consistently with external and internal team members.

Responsibilities (Specific tasks, duties, essential functions of the job):

  • Support pre-sales activities to manage the Security Review & RFP processes.
  • Track progress and report metrics on security review requests.
  • Partner with internal staff to develop and maintain security documentation.
  • Support Solution Design Architects with documentation of design information.
  • Work with customer technical staff to describe InTouch Health system and product architecture.
  • Support customer validation of products.
  • Maintains database of technical information, contact information, case creation and updates
  • Clearly communicates regularly and follows directives as decided by the team

Knowledge, Skills & Ability:

  • Excellence in written and verbal communication of technical material with various vendors, IT professionals, and core ITH team members.
  • Ability to cover multiple, overlapping complex projects; well organized and adaptable to changing demands.
  • Strong project management skills, attention to detail and able to prioritize to meet team objectives.
  • In-depth understanding and experience with wireless networks, set up, and configuration.
  • In-depth understanding and experience with networks, firewalls, and servers and the security of such devices.
  • Strong skills in document preparation and tools which facilitate document preparation.
  • Strong skills in Excel and statistical data analysis.
  • Understanding of SIP (Session Initiation Protocol).
  • Experience with PACS and knowledge of DICOM a plus.
  • Prior work experience in a hospital environment a plus.

Qualifications:

  • Degree in discipline relating to engineering, computer science, or Information Technology (IT).
  • CCNA designation highly desired.
  • Experience: 1-2 years of experience in healthcare field with background in technical sales support, security standards compliance and documentation, project management and coordination, healthcare IT or wireless infrastructure desired
  • Experience with Medical Devices and networks in Hospital settings.
  • Experience with SalesForce.com and database platforms.
  • Knowledge of VMWare and Linux OS a plus.

Working Conditions:

  • Professional office environment

Notes

For the qualified candidate, InTouch Health offers competitive compensation, medical, dental and vision benefits, paid time off, and 401(k) retirement plan. InTouch Health is based in sunny and beautiful Santa Barbara, California.

Apply for job

items.title: User Researcher
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We're looking for a User Researcher to join our team and help change the way the world deals with death. This is an incredible opportunity to have a real impact on people’s lives, by building products that empower them to navigate some of life’s hardest moments.


As well as working day to day in a multi-disciplinary product team, you’ll be joining a fast-growing design guild. At the moment we’re two product designers, a user researcher, a copywriter and marketing designer.


As a User Researcher at Farewill over the next 12 months you will:



  • take responsibility for planning and running a range of user research activities to support the design, development and continuous improvement of our products and services

  • analyse research data and identify actionable findings which you will communicate both to product teams and wider in Farewill

  • involve your team at every stage of research: from asking the right questions through to fieldwork and analysis

  • contribute to the culture of the design team and Farewill. For example, make useful contributions in design crits or represent the customers’ perspectives in discussions

  • support the wider Farewilll team in making customer-focused decisions by doing things like contributing to the business planning process

  • help everyone in Farewill to be better at being part of research by, for example, training people in how to interview customers or conduct usability tests






Who you are:


You’re a user researcher motivated to solve tough problems by deeply understanding users and their needs. You combine deep empathy with rigorous analysis and excellent communication. You have a firm grasp on the fundamentals of research and are looking to expand your experience and work in an environment where you can take on more complex problems.


We’re looking for someone who:



  • has experience running research in a multi-disciplinary product team

  • can take a problem and create a research plan from it

  • has excellent interviewing skills, both in facilitation and analysis

  • Is keen to develop their skills across a range of methods and get good at working in areas of high uncertainty

  • is an excellent communicator

  • is self-motivated and organised






What we offer in return:



  • Competitive salary and generous stock options

  • 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays

  • Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day

  • Off-site days and team lunches

  • Santander cycles membership!

  • The chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths

  • And much more


About Farewill:


At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. We help people take control - personally and financially - of what matters to them after they’re gone.


We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016. Since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.


Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our customer reviews) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and on Radio 4 among others. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £220 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.


Our team:


We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.


Based in our lovely office in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.


This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.


If you’d like to understand our culture and product better, here’s a few articles for you to read: About Farewill, Life at Farewill, Are you worried about your will?


Please note - In light of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, all Farewill employees are working remotely and we will be conducting all interviews virtually for the foreseeable future. We will continue hiring as usual.


Please include a portfolio with your application. This can be a link in your CV or cover letter. Any applications without a portfolio will be rejected.
