items.content:
Product Designer (UX/UI)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Designer
Company: Octopus Deploy – Brisbane, Australia

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+10:00) Eastern Time - Brisbane +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Brisbane, Australia. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

user-interface
user-experience
typescript
reactjs
Shape Up
Octopus Deploy

Job description

The best product development job in the world? We think so.We are looking for people who live and work in Australia to join our remote-first team. You will be working on Octopus Deploy, the most popular deployment automation tool in the world. This means everything you do will positively affect the lives of thousands of software developers around the world.Already seen enough? Click the button to apply and have a real conversation with a key leader from our team.As Product Designer, you will be working with one of three development teams who work across the entire Octopus ecosystem. We shape, bet, and build using a method inspired by Shape Up. Designers at Octopus help shape projects and work with the engineering teams during their 8-week build cycle. A designer's work brings clarity and direction to projects in using appropriate UX methods like user stories, workflows and prototypes. You will probably be surprised at how collaboratively we work both inside and across our teams, even though our teams work remotely. We take pride in our hard-earned, friendly, consensus-building, and ever-improving remote-first culture.Octopus is not a startup. We do not need venture capital, we have been a sustainably profitable business from day one. We care about building a sustainable company and we do this by helping customers succeed, leaving increased revenue as a happy byproduct.Keep reading if you want more details about the job. Otherwise, click the button to apply and have a real conversation with a key leader from our team.

You will be a great fit for this role if...

  • You have a firm grasp of UX methodologies and interaction design.
  • You are proficient in design tools such as Sketch or Adobe CC, handoff tools such as Zeplin or Invision.
  • You are proficient in HTML and CSS.
  • You are comfortable modifying an existing frontend codebase using a modern framework such as React, Vue or Angular.
  • You are an experienced individual contributor or leader in a similar role.
  • You have experience working in an agile environment with engineers.
  • You are comfortable making good decisions with general concepts like usability, user experience, and design; and perhaps you are a specialist in an area of product design.

You will enjoy this role if...

  • You are able to work independently, motivating yourself to do high-quality work on time.
  • You enjoy collaborating with other people to solve problems, challenging each other to discover the best solution for a problem, using a balance of passion, pragmatism, and empathy.
  • You are a results-oriented person, someone who is focused on iteratively delivering valuable things to your customers, someone who willingly changes direction based on clear and transparent business information, and someone who helps others do the same.

A typical day might include...

  • Working where you work best, perhaps in a home office designed by you, using a device of your choosing, with or without music, in an atmosphere you create for yourself.
  • Pairing with an engineer, product owner, or another designer to solve a UX, usability, or UI problem.
  • Collaborating on projects with your team.
  • Making frontend changes to the Octopus Server product to reduce design debt or bugs.
  • Using your UX methodology to contribute to a pitch.
  • Collaborating with engineers, debating ideas, and working together towards the best outcome for our users.
Apply

About Octopus Deploy

We make Octopus Deploy, software that enables teams to deliver working software to production. We've become the "best in class" tool in our category by focusing on doing one thing and doing it very well. Founded in 2012, we now have over 20,000 happy customers around the world, and we employ 50 wonderful people.We're not VC-funded; we've been profitable since day one and there's no big exit plan. It's all about the journey and building something that will last forever. In 2017 we were the #3 fastest growing company in Australia, and while we've grown quickly, we've done it conservatively. Our business model is all around understanding our customers, building great software, backing it up with great support and customer service, and making it incredibly easy to discover, learn and use.Most of our team is based in Brisbane, Australia, where the company started, though we've spread to other parts of Australia, the US, UK, and Argentina. Because our team is distributed, everyone works from home most of the week, so we've built a remote-first culture. We hope that you'll do your best work while at Octopus, and we trust you to find ways to work that work best for you and invest in your journey. That means freedom to choose the best location from which to work each day: it might mean working from home, from an office, a cafe, or a co-working place, or some combination through the day - whatever makes you most productive and able to do your best work that day. We know that great knowledge workers need great tools, and we have various programs available including a program to choose your own laptop, and an allowance for setting up the ultimate home office set up. We have a helpful, personable approach to feedback (1:1's and 360 reviews from your peers), a professional development program that revolves around your career journey and preparing you for the future, and a standardized approach to salary & job title reviews.Most importantly, we believe that what matters most in a job is the people you work with each day, knowing you're working on something that matters, where your work is appreciated, you have the opportunity to learn and grow, and where you have a manager that supports you. We work hard every day to ensure Octopus is a great place to work by those measures.

Senior Product Manager, Search Relevance

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Data Scientist, Product Manager
Industry: Graphic Design, Web Technology
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Eezy, LLC – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

machine-learning
hadoop
python
solr
elasticsearch

Job description

Job Description
Eezy is looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead our Search Relevance team to develop strategies and implement features to optimize the onsite search experiences for Vecteezy.com desktop and mobile. This role is primarily responsible for leading a team of engineers to improve the relevance of search by implementing algorithmic updates and monitoring effectiveness of the onsite search engine, which drives increased conversions, user engagement, and (ultimately) sales.

Responsibilities

  • Be the authoritative source for all things related to search relevance within our company. When people have questions, you have answers, or at least know where to look.
  • Maintain a product roadmap and backlog outlining stories and epics while prioritizing the backlog to focus on the highest impact work for our customers first.
  • Ideate and develop new search features and algorithms to enable the world to discover and download digital design assets. 
  • Lead a small and scrappy (yet highly talented) team of engineers and data scientists to define, design and build experiences that delight our 6M users each month.
  • Understand the needs of our users in order to prioritize new features and product enhancements for your team.
  • Release early and often, using A/B split-testing to optimize your way to glory.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience with analyzing, designing, building, testing and deploying search relevancy features within a business environment.
  • Solid understanding of search architectures, information retrieval, learning to rank concepts and personalization.
  • Understanding of machine learning algorithms and distributed systems
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Effective time management skills
  • Experience with big data / machine learning tools and frameworks, such as Python, Tensorflow, Keras, Spark, Hadoop or MapReduce
  • Industry experience developing and releasing machine learning algorithms or systems for NLP, classification, regression or clustering applications.
  • Experience optimizing search ranking and relevance functions in a related industry.
  • Experience with search technologies including SOLR, ElasticSearch and Lucene. This includes setup, configuration, and relevance tuning.
  • Experience working on multilingual search needs and natural language technology relevant to search.
  • Experience working within an Agile environment.
  • Owner mentality, willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary.

Eezy, is an equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, color, gender, religion, age, disability, or familial status.



Easy apply

About Eezy, LLC

We’re a rapidly growing tech-focused creative company located in Bowling Green, KY with a disruptive business model and an environment that can allow you to thrive. We're on a mission to unlock the creative potential in everyone by giving artists an opportunity to earn a living from their work. Millions of creative professions visit our network of websites each month to download stock vectors, videos, photos, and other types of design resources. We put emphasis on our G.A.R.D.E.N. core values because after all, we are in this together.

Our Values: We are seeking individuals who incorporate our G.A.R.D.E.N into their daily lives and work.

Genuine, Ambition, Reliable, Detailed, Enthusiastic, and Nimble

Benefits

  • Health Insurance
  • Retirement Profit Sharing
  • Retirement Cash Balance
  • PTO
  • Holiday Pay
  • Dental

items.title: Sr. Product Designer at Osmosis
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Sr. Product Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Designer, Product Manager
Company: Osmosis – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
design
product

Job description

Sr. Product Designer

Overview

Our rapidly scaling medical education technology company is seeking a Senior Product Designer to join our Product Team. In this role, you will be working with the Director of Product and Creative Director to design and deliver the best user learning experience to our learners.

About Osmosis

Our mission is to “Empower the world’s clinicians & caregivers with the best learning experience possible.” To this end, we have an audience of more than a million current & future clinicians as well as patients and family members. Our members of the Osmosis learning platform and video library use the product to learn efficiently & excel in classes, board exams, and in the clinic. 

We are a team of creative, approachable, and driven entrepreneurs, researchers, and clinicians who are passionate about improving healthcare and education. At Osmosis, we collaborate remotely and value highly-motivated problem solvers who manage their time efficiently, communicate earnestly, work effectively, and understand the importance of life-work balance.  We do everything we can to make sure our teammates are successful personally and professionally.

About the Role

As a Senior Product Designer, you will be a member of the Product team and coordinate within and across teams including customer success, marketing, and content teams to ensure that our learners receive the best learning experience possible by visualizing our backlog and roadmap. The ideal candidate will have a strong visual portfolio with demonstrated ability to perform user research, gather requirements, analyze and communicate findings, and to turn requirements into wireframes and prototypes applying best practices for usability, design systems, and information architecture. 

Key Responsibilities 

The responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Help define and improve the interface and learning experience on the Osmosis platform
  • Create deliverables (journey map, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc.) and execute high fidelity design 
  • Perform user research to solicit feedback by recruiting users to meet for design sessions, test beta products, usability tests, and complete surveys
  • Share findings with our team and explain how that will affect your design decisions
  • Stay informed on the latest UI/UX techniques, tools, and patterns and integrate best practices into design projects
  • Work with developers to iterate on and refine the current user experience
  • Assist the Creative Director with the creation and maintenance of UX documentation
  • QA test product features when needed

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of design experience on a successful product team, preferably at an education organization
  • Portfolio of visually pleasing, intuitive, and efficient user experiences 
  • Demonstrable experience defining the “why” and “how” of a project with inquisitive and design thinking mindset
  • Proven ability to balance the needs of users with the needs of an organization
  • Demonstrable experience analyzing user feedback in both qualitative quantitative formats: user research, a/b tests and other data driven methodologies
  • Ability to gather and create requirements for creative new user flows 
  • Ability to create information architecture changes to improve user experience.
  • Familiarity with tools like Figma and a willingness to learn new tools and softwares 

Preferred Attributes:

  • Studious. A keen interest in and deep understanding of web and mobile technology, particularly pertaining to an understanding of designing for learning experiences.
  • Negentropic. You bring order to everything you touch and have a keen attention to detail
  • Punctual. You deliver projects on time, and are able to prioritize high impact design input.
  • Communication Wizard. You can talk with learners, developers, and other team members to understand their needs, collaborate and find solutions. You can write the copy for designs. 
  • Lifelong learner. You are actively consuming content (podcasts, blogs, books, etc) and applying these learnings in your work to make sure you are as effective as possible. 
  • Value Oriented. You share our values, and demonstrate those values in your daily work.
  • Critical. You welcome feedback on your work and you thrive in environments where critical feedback is common.

This position is full time and remote. The ideal candidate will be based in North America.

Osmosis is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other status protected by law.

To apply, please submit the following to careers@osmosis.org: 

  • Resume
  • Portfolio: because this role requires UX design and user research skills, portfolios will only be considered if they include descriptions of projects and/or case studies
  • Submission of an Osmosis "Spread Joy" e-card.  At Osmosis we are working to develop the most caring people, and to this end have created the www.osmosis.org/spreadjoy tool. Please visit this page, create an Osmosis account, and send an e-card to someone and let us know what you thought of the experience.

Incomplete applications will not be considered.

Apply

About Osmosis

About Osmosis

Our mission is to “Empower the world’s clinicians & caregivers with the best learning experience possible.” To this end, we have an audience of more than a million current & future clinicians as well as patients and family members. Our members of the Osmosis learning platform and video library  use the product to learn efficiently & excel in classes, board exams, and in the clinic. 

We are a team of creative, approachable, and driven entrepreneurs, researchers, and clinicians who are passionate about improving healthcare and education. At Osmosis, we collaborate remotely and value highly-motivated problem solvers who manage their time efficiently, communicate earnestly, work effectively, and understand the importance of life-work balance.  We do everything we can to make sure our teammates are successful personally and professionally.

items.content:
RFP Analyst

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Designer, Product Manager
Industry: Government, Libraries, Web Hosting
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Interpersonal Frequency – No office location

Technologies

project-management
drupal
adobe-indesign
photoshop

Job description

Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a RFP Analyst to add to its growing sales team. 

What you’ll do:

  • Assess and vet all Request for Proposals (RFPS) for consideration
  • Provide an evaluation on client and project fit using our internal criteria (including budget and strategic value) and market sector analysis
  • Identify exceptions and possible issues included in the RFP
  • Participate in potential client information calls and Q&A sessions
  • Manage the RFP submission process, including creation of an internal schedule, assignment of tasks, ensuring proper requirements gathering, and meeting required deadlines
  • Draft custom responses to RFPs that are fully responsive, focus on client concerns, and articulate our strategic value
  • Complete all legal and administrative forms associated with the RFP
  • Manage the creation of technical web development proposals
  • Continuously update template responses to match our internal processes
  • Create and maintain a library of standard responses, technical requirements, team biographies, and templates
  • Assist with the creation and execution of sales strategy, sales messaging, and client follow up meetings
  • Manage the printing and shipping of proposals as needed

Requirements: 

  • You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply
  • 4+ years of experience in the field and/or formal training required; law degree or equivalent preferred 
  • Ability to read, understand, and analyze legal and technical documents to determine the needs of a potential client
  • Ability to interpret technical requirements and display them in an easy to understand format 
  • Proven ability to craft personalized and organized responses to RFPs 
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Bonus skills: Proficient knowledge of InDesign, Acrobat, Photoshop, and Excel
  • Ability to anticipate and adapt to changing conditions and opportunities
  • Ability to interact with clients, both technical and non-technical
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Willingness to travel to various locations across the United States
  • Demonstrated commitment to I.F. Purpose & Principles based on employment history, experience and interview(s).

Why work with us? 

  • Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members 
  • Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day 
  • Healthcare, and Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans 
  • Access to a 401(k)
  • Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule 
  • Work in a mostly virtual environment or a coworking location. If you work virtually, be prepared to travel at least once a quarter for face-to-face with the team. 

If you are interested, please send your cover letter, and resume to rfpanalyst@ifsight.com.

Interpersonal Frequency LLC is an Equal-Opportunity Employer (EOE).

Easy apply

About Interpersonal Frequency

At I.F., we’re putting the government in the cloud. We design, build, maintain, and grow sites on our open source, highly available web stack for some of the largest cities, public libraries, and government agencies in the country. Our company’s purpose is to make government online more relevant, accountable, and responsive to everyone. We also created a suite of proprietary analytics tools that survey 3.4 million Americans each day. We are growing quickly and are looking for several new positions, including this management role, to continue to deliver cutting-edge, open sourced websites for our clients.

I.F. is an 11 year-old company with team members in Seattle, Chicago,  Denver, New York, and the DC area, among others.

We provide a remote work environment, so you don’t need to move for this job. We encourage face to face collaboration in our regional offices and expect you to travel when required. As a purpose and principles-driven organization, we want talented team members who want to make a difference.

Working remotely means we can bring together some of the best minds in the country. Between video calls and Slack, the distance evaporates quickly, and ideas, projects and puns fly at the speed of light. Working remotely also allows us to find harmony in work / life balance.

Benefits

  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Access to training's and conferences in your field
  • 401(k) available by the end of this year
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Three competitive medical plans to chose from
  • Dental and vision plans
  • Long and short term disability insurance
  • Employer paid life insurance

items.title: Senior Product Marketer at Limelight Health
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Senior Product Marketer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Agile Software Development, Insurance, SaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Limelight Health – No office location

Technologies

saas
jira
agile
erp
crm

Job description

What We Do

Limelight Health helps empower insurance carriers to solve one of the most fundamental challenges in the employee benefits space; providing the right coverage to the right people, at the right price, and at the right time. 

What We Believe

We believe that the only way to achieve this lofty goal is to find and work with brilliant, compassionate individuals who are inspired by our company’s vision.

What We Envision

To us, vision isn’t a one-liner painted on the wall, but rather a three page document that helps drive every decision our team makes as we work towards a shared picture of what our company will be in December 2022. It’s a clear definition of success at a specific point in time - and it’s our internal compass.

One of the three sections in our vision is dedicated to the culture we’re intentionally building. Part of it reads:

“We have also gained a reputation as one of the best places to work in the U.S. Limelight is primarily a remote company by design, with a physical presence in strategic locations. These workspaces share a consistent Limelight look and feel, and provide employees nearby or traveling through with the option for in-person collaboration. But regardless of where they’re working on a given day, our team members feel like they have the resources they need to be their most effective.

Across the board, our employees have a deep understanding of our market, solutions, customers and users. New hires often tell us that our onboarding was the best they’ve experienced, but the industry context we provide doesn’t stop there. We are consistently growing our knowledge through continuing education. We also invest in our employees’ potential through professional and leadership development. Whether it’s connecting someone with an incredible mentor or supporting their transition into management, we strive to set team members up for success in their roles. Employees have a clear path to growth and many of them want to take the next step of their career within Limelight. High retention has helped us build expertise and capacity throughout the company, and there is a strong sense of ownership in each department.

Not only do we retain strong contributors, we attract them. Our continuous recruiting process keeps our pipeline full of high caliber candidates who are drawn to our innovative approach. Working at Limelight is not for everyone; it’s for people who can get on board with fellow “A” players, and develop their talents to the fullest as we navigate the fast-moving rapids of a changing industry. Limelight is for people who embrace the challenge of solving hard problems to build something great. Everyone takes responsibility for communicating their needs, and we respect and support each other’s boundaries. Managers work with their directs to reconcile short term needs with long term sustainability. Employees at Limelight give their all, and they truly feel appreciated for it. They know that at the end of the day we care about each other as people, and whatever we’re facing, we’re not doing it alone.”

Senior Product Marketer, Overview:

This is an exciting opportunity for a master storyteller to define and communicate Limelight’s Enterprise Platform solutions to buyers and the market. The Senior Product Marketer will be the first product marketer to join LLH, so the right marketer will get to realize their vision for product marketing best practices.

You will be responsible for defining our target markets and articulating how we can be successful in them. You will use research, analysis, empathy, and buyer focus to understand what business outcomes we can support for our target market, how they buy, and how to tell them we have products for them.  You will provide content that tells the story of our product.

In addition to creating content, you will analyze market segments to actively pursue and determine which channels best align with our markets' buying preferences. You will identify competitive and alternate offerings in the market, assess their strengths and weaknesses, and develop a strategy for winning against the competition.

 Requirements:

  • At least 3 years product marketing, sales engineering, or marketing experience on enterprise SaaS products of moderate to high complexity (ERP, CRM, ITSM, HRM, automation)
  • Experience creating, marketing, or selling software products to the US Insurance industry

Preferred experience:

  • Product-related experience with Mission-critical enterprise systems
  • Experience working in Agile software development teams
  • Pragmatic Marketing certification

Factors that may contribute to success in this role:

  • Business Acumen
  • Creativity
  • Customer Focus
  • Dealing With Ambiguity
  • Learning on the Fly
  • Presentation Skills
  • Strategic Agility
  • Understanding Others
  • Written Communications

** Please do not apply to this job unless you are authorized to work in the US. We are unable to offer sponsorship at this time.**

If you are an individual with a disability who requires reasonable accommodation to complete any part of our application process, please call our office at (877) 897-5005 for further assistance.

Limelight Health is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Apply

About Limelight Health

Limelight Health helps empower insurance carriers to solve one of the most fundamental challenges in the employee benefits space; providing the right coverage to the right people, at the right price, and at the right time.

We know that the only way to achieve this lofty goal is to find and work with brilliant, compassionate individuals who are inspired by our company’s vision.

Benefits

  • Remote work option
  • Competitive base salary
  • Unlimited paid time off
  • Stock options for all employees
  • Amazing company values
  • Fun, collaborative, and flexible environment
  • Full benefits package

items.title: RFP Analyst
items.content:
Interpersonal Frequency

RFP Analyst

Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a RFP Analyst to add to its growing sales team.  What you’ll do: * Assess and vet all Request for Proposals (RFPS) for consideration * Provide an evaluation on client and project fit using our internal criteria (including budget and strategic value) and market sector analysis * Identify exceptions and possible issues included in the RFP * Participate in potential client information calls and Q&A sessions * Manage the RFP submission process, including creation of an internal schedule, assignment of tasks, ensuring proper requirements gathering, and meeting required deadlines * Draft custom responses to RFPs that are fully responsive, focus on client concerns, and articulate our strategic value * Complete all legal and administrative forms associated with the RFP * Manage the creation of technical web development proposals * Continuously update template responses to match our internal processes * Create and maintain a library of standard responses, technical requirements, team biographies, and templates * Assist with the creation and execution of sales strategy, sales messaging, and client follow up meetings * Manage the printing and shipping of proposals as needed Requirements:  * You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply * 4+ years of experience in the field and/or formal training required; law degree or equivalent preferred  * Ability to read, understand, and analyze legal and technical documents to determine the needs of a potential client * Ability to interpret technical requirements and display them in an easy to understand format  * Proven ability to craft personalized and organized responses to RFPs  * Excellent project management skills * Bonus skills: Proficient knowledge of InDesign, Acrobat, Photoshop, and Excel * Ability to anticipate and adapt to changing conditions and opportunities * Ability to interact with clients, both technical and non-technical * Excellent verbal and written communication skills  * Willingness to travel to various locations across the United States * Demonstrated commitment to I.F. Purpose & Principles based on employment history, experience and interview(s). Why work with us?  * Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members  * Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day  * Healthcare, and Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans  * Access to a 401(k) * Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule  * Work in a mostly virtual environment or a coworking location. If you work virtually, be prepared to travel at least once a quarter for face-to-face with the team.  If you are interested, please send your cover letter, and resume to [email protected] Interpersonal Frequency LLC is an Equal-Opportunity Employer (EOE).

Assurance is the first and only platform to pair top insurance agents with data-driven technology to make the buying and selling experience timely, personalized, and simple.

Enjoy the freedom of working for yourself, and leave the marketing and admin work to ASSURANCE.

Join the ASSURANCE agent network, and enjoy these benefits::

  • 100% qualified, inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites
  • Free access to our proprietary system
  • Well-known and trusted carriers
  • 100s of Guides prospecting for you
  • A+ BBB-accredited and proven
  • Unlimited income potential with no chargebacks and weekly bonus opportunities
  • Daily support meetings (voluntary)

Requirements to access ASSURANCE platform:

  • At least 10 P&C state licenses, 8 of which should be in AR, AZ, CO, CT, IA, ID, IL, IN, MO, MS, NC, ND, NE, NM, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, WI, WV, WY
  • At least 1 year of telesales experience selling P&C products
  • Prior work as a captive agent or in an independent agency or call center
  • Very reliable computer and headset
  • High speed Internet connection
  • Self-driven and hungry
  • Able to establish yourself as an expert and provide policy guidance with the highest integrity
  • Persistence and systematic in the follow up to chase down shoppers after the first call
  • Active errors & omissions coverage
  • Experience with multiple carrier products and using a comparative rater is a preferred

items.title: Medicare Agent - remote work opportunity, qualified, inbound leads
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Medicare Insurance Agent – Industry-best comp plan, total work freedom

Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform, and earn from the industry’s best comp plan, selling trusted Medicare plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

Get paid before, during, and after AEP. During AEP, we offer service fee commissions and bonuses, just for helping shoppers. Then after AEP, enjoy the largest January payout you’ve ever seen.

Work as an independent, remote, contract agent. Enjoy the freedom of working when you want, from wherever you want, helping inbound, qualified, in-market shoppers – all free to you.

Access our system, and eliminate agency inefficiencies and waste with free training, admin, support, product recommendations, and analytics. It’s like Uber for insurance!

After AEP, sell MediGap, health, or life, all year-round.

Join the ASSURANCE agent network, and take advantage of these benefits:

  • Free live, active, inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated sites
  • Access to our proprietary system (includes no dialing, product recommendations, analytics, and constant platform improvement), at no cost to you
  • Well-known and trusted carriers
  • 100s of Guides prospecting for you
  • Accessible underwriters
  • A+ BBB-accredited and proven

Requirements to access ASSURANCE platform:

  • AHIP certification
  • 12+ life insurance state licenses
  • One year of phone sales experience
  • High speed Internet connection, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • Thorough understanding of HIPAA privacy and security laws, DNC, and insurance regulatory laws
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice
  • Working space and equipment that comply with HIPAA privacy and security standards

About ASSURANCE:

Everyone is unique. But insurance plans are not.

Too often, plans offer blanket coverage, charging customers for coverage they don’t need while not offering enough of what they do.

ASSURANCE celebrates individual uniqueness with our personalized approach to seeking and purchasing insurance. Our platform serves as the intersection between customer and seller, technology and the human touch.

We start by asking customers a few questions to learn about their needs. From there, our ground-breaking, proprietary platform analyzes the thousands of data points that make customers unique. This is how we create custom-tailored plans for each and every kind of customer; plans built precisely for their needs and budget.

Our team of engineers, data scientists, marketers, architects, and designers are building systems using advanced science to make humans better. We’re eliminating insurance industry waste and simplifying the complex.

While our technology helps us personalize coverage, our network of experienced agents is how we deliver the right insurance to our customers.

All ASSURANCE Medicare agents are 1099, independent contractors and have maximum control over how, where, and when they do their work. ASSURANCE simply provides the tools to make your business as successful as possible.

Join ASSURANCE as we reimagine the role of insurance and enhance the personal and financial health of all consumers.

items.content:
Assurance is the first and only platform to pair top insurance agents with data-driven technology to make the buying and selling experience timely, personalized, and simple.

Enjoy the freedom of working for yourself, and leave the marketing and admin work to ASSURANCE.

Join the ASSURANCE agent network, and enjoy these benefits::

  • 100% qualified, inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites
  • Free access to our proprietary system
  • Well-known and trusted carriers
  • 100s of Guides prospecting for you
  • A+ BBB-accredited and proven
  • Unlimited income potential with no chargebacks and weekly bonus opportunities
  • Daily support meetings (voluntary)

Requirements to access ASSURANCE platform:

  • At least 10 P&C state licenses, 8 of which should be in AR, AZ, CO, CT, IA, ID, IL, IN, MO, MS, NC, ND, NE, NM, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, WI, WV, WY
  • At least 1 year of telesales experience selling P&C products
  • Prior work as a captive agent or in an independent agency or call center
  • Very reliable computer and headset
  • High speed Internet connection
  • Self-driven and hungry
  • Able to establish yourself as an expert and provide policy guidance with the highest integrity
  • Persistence and systematic in the follow up to chase down shoppers after the first call
  • Active errors & omissions coverage
  • Experience with multiple carrier products and using a comparative rater is a preferred

items.content:
Medicare Insurance Agent – Industry-best comp plan, total work freedom

Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform, and earn from the industry’s best comp plan, selling trusted Medicare plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

Get paid before, during, and after AEP. During AEP, we offer service fee commissions and bonuses, just for helping shoppers. Then after AEP, enjoy the largest January payout you’ve ever seen.

Work as an independent, remote, contract agent. Enjoy the freedom of working when you want, from wherever you want, helping inbound, qualified, in-market shoppers – all free to you.

Access our system, and eliminate agency inefficiencies and waste with free training, admin, support, product recommendations, and analytics. It’s like Uber for insurance!

After AEP, sell MediGap, health, or life, all year-round.

Join the ASSURANCE agent network, and take advantage of these benefits:

  • Free live, active, inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated sites
  • Access to our proprietary system (includes no dialing, product recommendations, analytics, and constant platform improvement), at no cost to you
  • Well-known and trusted carriers
  • 100s of Guides prospecting for you
  • Accessible underwriters
  • A+ BBB-accredited and proven

Requirements to access ASSURANCE platform:

  • AHIP certification
  • 12+ life insurance state licenses
  • One year of phone sales experience
  • High speed Internet connection, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • Thorough understanding of HIPAA privacy and security laws, DNC, and insurance regulatory laws
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice
  • Working space and equipment that comply with HIPAA privacy and security standards

About ASSURANCE:

Everyone is unique. But insurance plans are not.

Too often, plans offer blanket coverage, charging customers for coverage they don’t need while not offering enough of what they do.

ASSURANCE celebrates individual uniqueness with our personalized approach to seeking and purchasing insurance. Our platform serves as the intersection between customer and seller, technology and the human touch.

We start by asking customers a few questions to learn about their needs. From there, our ground-breaking, proprietary platform analyzes the thousands of data points that make customers unique. This is how we create custom-tailored plans for each and every kind of customer; plans built precisely for their needs and budget.

Our team of engineers, data scientists, marketers, architects, and designers are building systems using advanced science to make humans better. We’re eliminating insurance industry waste and simplifying the complex.

While our technology helps us personalize coverage, our network of experienced agents is how we deliver the right insurance to our customers.

All ASSURANCE Medicare agents are 1099, independent contractors and have maximum control over how, where, and when they do their work. ASSURANCE simply provides the tools to make your business as successful as possible.

Join ASSURANCE as we reimagine the role of insurance and enhance the personal and financial health of all consumers.

items.title: The Vaan Group: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=8, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Thanks for your interest in the Senior Product Designer position at The Vaan Group!

A little background:

My name is Chuong Nguyen-Thanh, a co-founder of The Vaan Group - a remote-first digital agency, headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, and we’re looking to add a dedicated and experienced senior product designer to our growing team. We believe awesome technology powers the best brands. So we build it. Our technology becomes the foundation upon which businesses scale their operations, escalate their marketing efforts and grow their sales. Most of the time we're building e-commerce engines. Other times we're architecting software. Regardless of what we’re making, it's always all digital.

Recent projects we’ve taken on range from designing and building a new admin panel for this innovative e-commerce SaaS company, to leading the UX design efforts for this Fortune 500 company’s overhaul of all its e-commerce properties. We’re also a certified Shopify Plus Agency Partner, and so we do a lot of work using the Shopify platform. You can see the full range of client work/portfolio at our website. In addition to our service-based work, we also like to experiment with technology by building our own digital products - everything from e-commerce applications to project management browser extensions. 

We’re a realistic group, not necessarily looking for rockstars, ninjas or wizards. Our team resides (or is working from) New York City, Poland, Portugal, The Netherlands, Brazil, Dominican Republic, Norway, Serbia, Algeria, and more. We’re big on team chemistry and we take asynchronous communication pretty seriously - we also have several company meetups each year, somewhere in the world, so that we continuously grow together, as a team. 


On any given day, you might:
  • Kick-off a new e-commerce website design & development project by leading a design requirements and discovery meeting with a client
  • Work independently or collaboratively with team members to produce UX deliverables like: a website audit report; information architecture maps; personas, customer journey maps, wireframes; high-fidelity mockups; interactive prototypes, and design systems 
  • Perform user research such as card sorting exercises, usability testing, and user interviews/surveys
  • Produce heuristic and competitive analysis reports for a web project
  • Play a key role in a design review & feedback gathering session with a client and our project management team
  • Work collaboratively with engineers from our team to communicate design specifications and requirements for a web project
  • Support a client’s web project launch through things like: performing creative quality assurance and logging feedback tickets using our project/product management software, work with a client to help them get acclimated with their new CMS, and coordinating with our project management team to ensure all product requirements have been checked off before going live 


The ideal person:
  • Understands the demands and expectations of a remote working culture - this one’s especially important to us!
  • Is comfortable working collaboratively with product management, project management, engineering, visual/product design, and other stakeholders, in a remote setting
  • Is highly motivated, detail-oriented, and capable of thriving in a fast-paced role with limited supervision
  • Has excellent organizational, presentation, and interpersonal skills 
  • Has demonstrated problem solving skills to come up with strategy and tactics when addressing new product design problems and scenarios
  • Has experience leading and supporting multiple design projects at the same time
  • Has a portfolio or samples of work that demonstrate design acumen and strategic design
  • Has experience leading and supporting e-commerce design projects from concept to launch
  • Is comfortable using both quantitative and qualitative data to guide design decisions
  • Has experience working with e-commerce, content, and other similar management systems, e.g. Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, etc.
  • Approaches product design with a keen understanding of both the target user and business requirements
  • Is highly proficient using existing design tools, e.g. Sketch, Figma, Framer, etc. and not afraid to learn new technologies
  • Has experience creating high-fidelity interactive prototypes for internal and stakeholder review
  • Is a team player and always willing to knowledge-share and contribute to the growth of the team


You bring: 
  • 5+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, product designer, or similar role
  • 3+ years of experience designing for mobile, web and web-based devices
  • Excellent UX, UI, and interaction design skills
  • Fluency in best practices for web-based product design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques
  • **Bonus - proficiency in front-end programming languages: HTML, CSS, Javascript

Other things you should know: 
  • Salary commensurate with experience
  • We offer unlimited vacation days
  • We offer benefits such as employer-sponsored healthcare coverage, qualifying equipment stipends depending on where you’re located
  • We offer an employee profit-sharing program 

Please include a link to your portfolio or other samples of work with your application

Remote | Part-time

Description

  • JOB TITLE: Boatswain’s Mate SME

items.title: Content Marketing Coordinator
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Position Overview

Content marketing is one of the core engines that runs our business and allows us to get our life-changing courses into the hands of those who need them most.

Our ability to produce hyper-relevant and helpful content for both people who’ve never heard of us AND our existing audience is a pretty big deal ‘round these parts.

If you’re a creative, organized, digital marketing savvy self-motivated superstar who’s up to the task of helping us crank our content marketing engine to full capacity, keep reading…

This position’s primary focus is to assist in the development, implementation, and optimization of the company’s overall marketing content strategy. You’re a master in understanding performance and priorities, and able to assist the Marketing team in the creation of original content to attract cold and warm audiences to our world (and offerings).

The Content Marketing Coordinator will be directly supporting our Inbound Marketing Manager, who is responsible for inbound marketing initiatives such as ongoing lead generation/funnels, content marketing, website optimization, marketing automation, SEO, and more. In addition, this role will also be supporting our Product Marketing Team during launches.

We’re looking for someone with strong copywriting skills who understands the importance of brand voice, quality content, and has some understanding of SEO. You’ll be writing content for assets like free guides, lead generation quizzes, blog posts, LinkedIn articles, checklists, cheat sheets, video scripts, pre-launch content and more.

Amy’s known for her ability to break big ideas and strategies down into bite sized, easy to understand pieces and it’ll be your job to create content that does the same.

As a company that teaches online marketing, it’s important that our Content Marketing Coordinator is committed to excellence and always up to learn new things. We need someone who’s experienced, confident, and ready to dive in headfirst and make things happen!

This role is full-time and work-from-home. In addition to working alongside our Inbound Marketing Manager, you’ll also work closely with other key team members in both the Marketing and Content Department .

We’re not your average company — we always make sure our team members have plenty of freedom and flexibility to live their best lives, recharge, and have fun (major perks of working as a remote team!)

That said, the online marketing world doesn’t take breaks — that’s why we need our team members to be flexible too. The tasks required in this role typically fit into an 8-6pm schedule but during product launches, we sometimes tap into hours outside that range.

Our dream Content Marketing Coordinator is open to finding their own rhythm and creating a schedule that serves their life while aligning with the guiding principle of “until the job is done.”

Duties and Responsibilities

The Content Marketing Coordinator will be creating content that’s appealing to both cold audiences and our current audience. You’ll be creating content for social campaigns, lead magnets, product launches and other relevant areas. Strong copywriting skills are essential to this role!

This position requires strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Our ideal candidate will understand how to meet our audience where they’re at — they need to know how to communicate and break down big ideas and strategies step-by-step (Amy style!) We’re looking for a creative self-starter who can take our direction and run with it to create valuable, and high-quality content that will serve to attract more of our ideal clients.

Some of your responsibilities will include…

  • Support the Inbound Marketing Manager in the creation and execution of online campaigns for web traffic, lead generation, branding, and more
  • Creating content for content marketing assets like lead magnets, video scripts, blog posts, and promotional materials
  • Assist in campaign creation efforts by collaborating on projects with internal and external team members and partners
  • Provide QA for content by proofreading for spelling, grammar, punctuation, readability, and SEO best practices
  • Create clear, concise and grammatically correct copy for PR and internal campaigns, often with short deadlines
  • Work closely with Inbound Marketing Manager and Community team to execute social campaigns for promotions, lead magnets, product launches and other relevant opportunities
  • Upload content to CMS (WordPress)
  • Stay up-to-date on what our competitors and industry leaders are doing, making suggestions for what we can learn and improve
  • Repurpose existing content for use across different channels
  • Conceptualize and draft SEO-friendly captions, articles, and posts for a number of channels and audiences
  • Support our PR agency and other external partners as needed
  • Working with the content team to ensure marketing outreach and initiatives from both departments align and support each other

Skills and Abilities

The ideal candidate possesses the following strengths and skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • Excellent copywriting skills
  • 2+ years’ experience in the world of digital marketing, launches, and project management
  • Understanding of inbound marketing
  • You’re a great writer with a knack for taking big concepts and breaking them down so they’re easy for people to understand
  • You understand the importance of keeping a consistent brand voice and you always prioritize clear over clever
  • A strong understanding of the importance of high-quality content in the digital marketing stratosphere and intimate knowledge of all the steps involved in the creation process
  • You’re able to spot a typo from a mile away and transform B+ content into A+ with ease
  • Motivation comes easily to you, you’re a self-starter but you also love collaboration and working with a talented team
  • Juggling multiple projects and to-do’s simultaneously is no problem for you — you work well under pressure, meet deadlines and keep promises
  • Insane attention to detail and high standards when it comes to quality
  • General understanding of WordPress (or similar CMS) and Google Analytics
  • Experience with Asana or a similar project management tool
  • Basic understanding of on and off page SEO best practices
  • Basic understanding of keyword research
  • Strong editorial skills
  • Excellent research skills
  • Outstanding communication skills (both written and verbal) — you have a knack for offering and receiving constructive feedback and ensuring everyone is on the same page

Although we permit “side gigs” / work outside this role, it must not compete or overlap with the work we do, or interfere with your role and responsibilities within the team. Any consulting, coaching or side gigs related to marketing, business building or entrepreneurship are not permitted. This allows us to project a united front, show that we are in this together as one business, and have the greatest possible impact.

If you want to step into a role with a great opportunity, enjoy knowing all the details and have an entrepreneurial spirit, this just might be the role for you!

Want to learn a little bit more about us? Keep reading!

What We Do:

We empower entrepreneurs to build profitable online businesses that bring creative, professional and personal freedom.

In everything we do, we aim to inspire confidence and action. Our signature service is helping budding entrepreneurs break free in the areas of business that were once holding them back into new levels of joy and fulfillment. We give these entrepreneurs tangible proof that small actions every day will ultimately build a business worth creating and a life guided by their own design.

We lead a fun-loving culture and a dedicated team that is committed to excellence. We always find the upside to any situation and maintain the strength and flexibility to change course as our business evolves.

Meet Amy

You might know Amy Porterfield from her top-rated “Online Marketing Made Easy” podcast, or from the courses and webinars she offers to help entrepreneurs build their business through social media and online marketing strategies.

Our Values

Our team is ambitious (always striving for excellence), hungry (competitive to the core; always wanting to be at the top) and enthusiastic (always excited about the work we are doing.)

We do whatever it takes to get the job done.

  • “That’s not my job” is not part of our vocabulary.
  • Since we are a small, but mighty team, we jump in where needed and are not afraid to get our hands dirty in the details.
  • We do whatever it takes to do the best we can in our specific roles.

When it comes to our customers and community, we lead with compassion.

  • We understand that everyone is doing the very best they can in the moment.
  • We subscribe to the belief that everyone we connect with is fighting their own battle we know nothing about.
  • We believe that compassion and kindness are exactly what they need to keep moving forward.

We are all coachable.

  • We are willing to make mistakes, learn from them quickly and continue to grow.
  • We put down our defenses, take a moment to process, take the feedback and run with it.

We each take complete ownership of our roles.

  • Never will you see us pass off our job or project to someone else.
  • Although we know we can always ask for help, we keep our own monkeys.
  • We each feel extreme pride in the work we are doing and we own our projects like a boss.

We are resourceful to the core. You will never hear us say it can’t be done. We will find a way.

  • We are creative, strategic and thoughtful in our actions. We believe there is always a way to make it work and we will do the digging to figure it out.
  • We don’t expect others on the team to tell us what to do or how to do it. We always help each other out when needed, but ultimately, when needed, we do the work to figure things out.

We laugh . . . a lot.

  • We genuinely like working with each other, so finding the fun in the moment, even when things are tough, it is just part of our culture.

Team Porterfield Perks:

Did we forget to mention all of the Team Porterfield perks? We’re fast-paced and rapidly growing. Our small but mighty team is full of talented and motivated individuals who enjoy coming into work. But these awesome perks help just a little too:

The Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation, bonus potential and flexible-time-off, along with ample company paid holidays
  • Health Insurance
  • Generous 401K Program
  • Never working on your birthday again! Hit the beach or the spa, we don’t care what you do, just don’t come to work!

The Team:

  • What can we say? We really like each other! From team-building events and happy hours to annual team trips, we like to work hard and play hard!
  • Plus you’ll be workin’ for boss lady Amy Porterfield! (Did you know she was nominated for Forbes’ Top Social Media Influencer?)

The Culture:

  • Forget the traditional corporate culture. Amy left that behind years ago for a reason and has created something entirely different! Have a question? Have an emergency? Having a bad day? At Team Porterfield we’re all family and here to support you however we can!

The Development:

  • Something you’ve always wanted to learn? We offer annual professional and personal development opportunities and you get to choose!

While still taking care of business we like to take care of our community too! Whether it’s participating in the office food drive or Amy’s annual charitable bonus, giving back is important to Team Porterfield!

Apply for job

Job description

User Research International is a research company based out of Redmond, Washington. Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience. We are currently conducting a research study called Admin Management. We are looking for currently employed Full-Time Workers who administer or manage productivity tools for their company. This study is a one-time remote via an online meeting. We’re offering $125 for participation in this study. Session lengths are 1 hour. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products or software. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. Completing this survey does not guarantee you will be selected to participate.  If it's a match, we'll reach out with a formal confirmation and any additional details you may need.

I have summarized the study details below. In order to be considered, you must take the survey below. Thank you!

Study: Admin Management Study 

Gratuity: $125

Session Length: 1 Hour  

Location: Remote 

Dates: Available dates are located within the survey

Survey: Admin Management Study

Easy apply

About User Research International

We use your experience to improve upon the products you use. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your experience. 

Benefits

  • Paid research studies
  • Improving tech
  • Getting your feedback and experience
  • Meeting researchers working directly on the products you use

items.title: Advisor - Marketplace expert
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Larks Advisor - Marketplace expert - Finding your community online


 


Larks is a platform that makes it easy to find your community online through shared passions.


The Market


Mental health and loneliness are growing rapidly, as people are at home with limited social opportunities. Unemployment has thus far doubled, with more people furloughed as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Larks connects these two audiences by creating a marketplace that offers online social activities supplied by the community. 


Our vision


Imagine a world where anyone interested in taking part in a club, activity or learning a new skill could do so easily from home. From cooking, reading, knitting, photography, nutrition and many more, you can invite existing friends to join your experience or make new friends through shared passions. 


Imagine being able to launch a new activity or club centred around your passion, and make money out of it from home. The scope is enormous, the market in the millions and impact on people's mental and social well-being profoundly positive. There is currently no single place for people to easily find relevant and engaging online social activities.  


Most online activity marketplaces are based around face to face activities, online there are many streamed instructional videos but few interactive experiences where you can genuinely engage with others. Larks is the first marketplace that makes it easy to list and find online, community-lead social activities. 


About us


This is an opportunity to work on a greenfield project in an industry that is undergoing sector re-defining changes as we speak. Millions of people are socialising differently and have been forced to change their mindsets around online interactions and what it means to be part of a community. We’re building the first home of online activities and communities as demand sky-rockets. This is an opportunity to join at the beginning and be a key part of an exciting and fast-growing project. We’re an experienced team, working remotely with a strong culture. We have a large network of activity providers and have spotted this gap in the market through testing a live and successful MVP.


 


About you 


You’ve deep experience in marketplace businesses either in developing or operating them and have worked for some of the biggest consumer marketplaces. You are passionate about our mission of building online communities and excited about how early-stage we are.


There’s some flexibility around how the role could be structured depending on experience and availability.


 


Apply


 


Drop us an email with your CV or just your linkedin profile and a brief note to explain why you’re interested in this opportunity.

items.title: Cro Metrics: Growth Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Product Manager


Like a lot of companies right now, Cro Metrics has put hiring on hiatus. However, we’re seeing the light at the end of the tunnel and we hope to begin evaluating resumes in the next 2-3 months. If you’re interested in a position with us, please take a look at our job description below and submit an application. We’ll send you a confirmation we received it, but you may not hear back right away. However, we promise when we resume hiring we’ll reach out. Thank you.


As a Growth Product Manager at Cro Metrics, you will be a hybrid product manager, strategic thinker, account manager and data analyst. Your primary role is to partner with our clients to improve their websites through Conversion Rate Optimization (data-driven experimentation and personalization). A Growth Product Manager spends much of their time interfacing with clients, designers and engineers. On the client side, the Growth Product Manager must be able to generate data-driven ideas that will improve revenue and other key metrics on client websites.

Experience and skills:
  • 5+ years experience working in digital product management, user experience (UX), web analytics or similar role(s) on consumer-facing web products
  • Experience running A/B/n tests using leading testing platforms such as Optimizely, VWO, Google Optimize, Dynamic Yield, etc.
  • Agency experience is highly preferred
  • Built and delivered product road maps full of winning and losing ideas
  • Strong presentation and communication skills
  • Hands-on experience analyzing digital business data to inform decisions and plan strategically

Personality:
  • Lifelong learner
  • Passionate about using data to improve user experiences
  • Enjoy working cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment
  • Genuinely enjoy working with clients and their distributed stakeholder groups
  • Love product strategy, but obsessed with the details on execution

Company Benefits
  • 100% remote, continue to work from where you are based
  • Health insurance reimbursement allowance
  • Retirement plan with 4% company match (subject to a 3 month waiting period)
  • Professional gear (e.g. MacBook, monitor, and noise-canceling headset)
  • Annual All Hands trips
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Liberal vacation policy
  • Access to group performance coaching sessions

items.content:
Remote | International
  • Marketing
  • Remote job

Job description

ShortPoint is looking for a creative and passionate Digital Marketing Executive to join our Marketing team.

In this position, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills by working closely alongside the Marketing Manager to execute successful digital marketing campaigns. You will be responsible for creating engaging content, developing and managing digital marketing campaigns across all social channels and overseeing pay per click ad management. In addition, you will assist with the management of the SEO strategy, Email Marketing, and will be an expert on Google Adwords. You will stay up to date with the latest trends within digital marketing, and will provide valuable data insights to help develop the marketing strategy and forecast budgets to ensure the successful implementation of all campaigns.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop engaging online content including social media posts, newsletters, and blogs; monitor and analyze content success.
  • Performing activities relating to Search Engine Optimization on a continuous basis.
  • Creating and executing email marketing campaigns.

What We Offer:

  • Flexibility in vacations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Working remotely;
  • Team building and activities & Annual meetups with the whole team
  • Fitness activities expenses covered;
  • Very dynamic culture and a friendly, helpful team.

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in Social Media, SEO or PPC
  • 3+ years of experience in content marketing
  • BSc/BA in marketing or relevant field

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States

Making the invisible visible. By harnessing the power of artificial intelligence, and smart medical device development, we’re advancing the practice of medicine for doctors and society. And we’re just getting warmed up.

The Opportunity:

AliveCor seeks a Digital Marketing Specialist to join the exciting start-up that is changing the face of mobile health. The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for setting up, optimizing and reporting on digital advertising campaigns for AliveCor. This includes managing, optimizing and reporting on paid search, social media, email marketing and digital advertising campaigns. The ideal candidate will have experience with Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Amazon Ads/Amazon Seller-Support and Mailchimp. The candidate will have an interest in data and analytics with a willingness to learn and optimize all advertising platform.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage and optimize all digital advertising campaigns to achieve the highest potential conversions
  • Test new advertising targeting strategies and tactics
  • Manage the email marketing lists and collection
  • Work with Amazon Support as listing issues arise
  • Work with Google Ads to ensure paid search and display is optimized and driving conversions
  • Report updated digital metrics to the Marketing Manager

Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing or equivalent experience
  • 2+ years’ experience with managing digital advertising campaigns in Google Ads and Facebook Ads
  • A certification in Google Ads, Facebook Ads or both
  • Familiarity with the Amazon Seller platform
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Basic understanding of impressions, CTR, CPM, Reach and Frequency
  • Strong data analysis skills

Location:

This position can be based remotely. We want the best candidate and will not let geography get in our way.

The Perks:

AliveCor is located in downtown Mountain View, CA. We are close to Caltrain and supply car and bike parking for employees. We strive to make your life outside work as smooth as possible while you’re at work, and we offer a long list of benefits to make that happen.

  • Competitive salary and competitive stock options
  • Flexible and generous vacation policy
  • Maternity / Paternity Leave
  • 401(k) matching
  • Employee 100% covered for medical, dental and vision
  • Mobile reimbursement
  • Stocked kitchen + weekly catered lunches
  • A supportive, collaborative group of people who understand that success depends on the team
Apply for job

items.title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States

Job description

Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate teams across the country. With over 1,000 real estate teams on our platforms, we’re generating 1MM+ leads annually. We love self-described “digital marketing nerds” who love marketing strategy, data and execution. At Ylopo, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a team of talented digital marketers and engineers who love building ad technology.

We are seeking a well-organized, tech-savvy Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our marketing team. In this role, you will be the liaison between our digital marketing department and our clients. The role entails rolling up your sleeves to understand client issues; problem-solve with team members with the ultimate goal of improving our client performance and overall ROI.

The ideal candidate has experience in a client service or account management background with the demonstrated ability to communicate, diagnose and problem solve with both clients & team members. This is a great opportunity for someone who has an account management background to transition into a career in digital marketing. We will teach the right candidate from the ground up how to leverage sophisticated digital marketing platforms across search engine marketing, social media marketing, analytics and much more! We are looking to fill a full-time position, and the right candidate will have the opportunity to grow within the company.

Example Responsibilities:

  • Communicate with clients to understand and troubleshoot issues with their marketing accounts
  • Work with marketing team members to optimize individual client accounts
  • Setup of marketing campaigns on Google Adwords and Facebook Editor
  • Create of reports related to marketing activities primarily on excel
  • Coordinate marketing activities between the client support team and marketing
  • Create and post advertisements from templates (Facebook, AdWords, etc.)
  • Complete data entry for CRM system and spreadsheets
  • Update and maintain records and run regular reports from multiple data systems
  • Collaborate across sales, marketing, and technical teams on various projects as they arise

Position Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication & account management skills
  • The idea of have daily consultative conversations with clients is exciting to you
  • Working knowledge of online marketing (SEM, SEO, Social Ads) preferred but not necessary
  • Intermediate and above level of excel knowledge preferred (ex. Know how to create a pivot table, use vlookup’s, etc.)
  • Must be extremely organized and detail-oriented
  • Ability to quickly learn new processes and procedures
  • Ability to effectively prioritize projects and workloads
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

The person in this role would:

  • Set up, optimize and maintain multiple PPC campaigns in AdWords and Bing for clients nationwide.
  • Spend considerable time analyzing data and building reports via Excel with ability to build Access databases and queries in MYSQL a major plus
  • Experience in using bid optimization platforms would be helpful (we primarily use Optimizer)
  • Conduct competitor research where appropriate.
  • Communicate with internal sales staff and fellow marketing team members.
  • Analyze website traffic across multiple channels in-order-to recommend changes or make optimizations.
  • Make recommendations to both the size, scale, and effectiveness of your advertising efforts to both sales staff and current and potential clients.
  • Stay up to date with the latest PPC trends, tools, and best practices and take that information and communicate with other agency staff and clients.
  • Analyze what marketing channels (Search, Shopping, Display, etc) would be most effective at meeting client goals.
  • Compile and complete weekly and monthly reports and communicate results to both clients and/or account managers.
  • Communicate with clients about all Google properties, including Paid Search, SEO, Google Maps and how they relate to each other.

Qualifications …

  • Minimum of 1-3 years Paid Search experience managing multiple clients, agency level experience preferred.
  • On a team with experience managing scaled SEM campaigns ($100K+ monthly budgets preferred)
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Experience with Google Analytics & Tag Manager a plus
  • Experience in Access and MYSQL a plus

Salary Range:

  • $45-$55K DOB

Job Type:

  • Full-Time

Location:

  • Full time remote is available nationally (US only), for those close to our offices in Santa Monica, CA or Phoenix, AZ we have flexible office hours based on training and collaboration needs.
Apply for job

items.title: REMOTE CERNER PATHNET ANALYST
items.content:
CTG is seeking a Cerner Laboratory Systems Analyst for a remote opportunity, supporting the PathNet module.

Job responsibilities will include:

Provide application support services for Cerner PathNet

Analyze service requests, and make recommendations related to best practices

Follow client’s documented Demand Management process to obtain approval for changes.

Build application changes in Test, work with user to complete testing, and move to production according to the client’s change control process.

Provide support for projects and other special application initiatives

Troubleshoot complex user errors and provide timely and high quality customer service

Document issues and solutions

Participate in the day to day tracking and follow-up on issues and questions of daily operations.

Validate and support system testing efforts

Work with client users and functional teams as needed

Escalate issues to the vendor as needed, and monitor vendor tickets for resolution

Utilize the ticket management system to track issue status and work volume

Participate in a 24/7 after hours on call rotation

After an initial Knowledge Transfer period of 2 to 4 weeks at the client site, work will be performed remotely.

5+ years’ experience in support and build of Cerner PathNet

Excellent troubleshooting skills, with the ability to communicate resolutions to customers

Prefer prior experience working remotely to provide production support

In depth knowledge of Laboratory workflows required; Med Tech or other clinical experience

These are Tier 3 positions – analysts should have strong build and troubleshooting expertise in the Cerner module identified

Experience in multiple Cerner modules is highly preferred

Please apply online or for immediate consideration, please send your resume to Holly.Christian@CTG.com

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) has developed a reputation for responsiveness and reliability - traits that our clients say set us apart - since our founding in 1966. Today, we provide comprehensive information, technology, and business solutions that address critical challenges for clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. Backed by a proven track record of reliable delivery, CTG fosters long-term client relationships and trust, which allows us to develop strategic insights that maximize client investments and competitive advantage. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India and regularly posts news and other important information online at www.ctg.com.

Our culture is a direct result of the people who work at CTG, the values we hold, and the actions we take. In other words, our people are the culture. It's a living, breathing thing that is renewed every day through the ways we engage with each other, our clients, and our communities. Part of our mission is to cultivate a workplace that attracts and develops the best people, reflected by our recognition as a Great Place to Work-certified company across many of our global operations.

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. CTG will assure equal opportunity and consideration to all applicants and employees in recruitment, selection, placement, training, benefits, compensation, promotion, transfer, and release of individuals without regard to race, creed, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, age, disability, marital or veteran status, citizenship status, or any other discriminatory factors as required by law. Our Affirmative Action program serves to promote occupational equality and diversity through good faith efforts. CTG is fully committed to promoting employment opportunities for members of protected classes.

Additional Information

Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years)

Work Remote: Yes

Travel: No
